Evil Eye Charm.name: Evil Eye Charm
Evil Eye Charm.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Orc shamans have been using eye-shaped glass amulets to protect against charms, curses, hexes, and misfortunes for millennia. The Evil Eye Charm has been imbued with strong defensive magic. It provides two benefits while it is on your person:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and against enchantment and necromancy spells.
  • The charm has 5 charges. If you fail a saving throw against a spell or an effect that would inflict a curse on you, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and turn the failed save into a successful one. Additionally, you can expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl] from it.

The charm crumbles into powder and is destroyed when its last charge is expended.

Succeed Saving Throw.name: Succeed Saving Throw
Succeed Saving Throw.condition: when you fail a saving throw against a spell or an effect that would inflict a curse on you

Taulmir, Meloria's Bow.name: Taulmir, Meloria's Bow
Taulmir, Meloria's Bow.description:
Weapon (longbow), artifact (requires attunement)

A gift of Mother Nature to her daughter Meloria before the age of mortals, Taulmir is an ageless weapon made to defend mortalkind against horrors that defy the natural order. Since the rise of the warring gods, the bow had lain dormant in the form of a seemingly mundane seed, waiting for a spark of nature magic to reawaken.

This magic bow grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it and deals an extra 2d8 piercing damage. It scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

Lifewood Weapon. Taulmir is made of eternally living wood and draws its power from Otherwood, the mystical realm of Nature. The bow is light enough to float on water, yet it is indestructible outside of Otherwood.

Primeval Essence. While attuned to Taulmir, you have advantage on initiative rolls, and on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you are immune to disease, poison, and the poisoned condition, and have resistance to necrotic damage.

Sharpleaf Arrows. While holding the bow, you can use a bonus action to create 20 sharpleaf arrows from the wood of the bow. These arrows ignore half cover and resistance to piercing damage. After 10 minutes, sharpleaf arrows bloom and transform into ordinary flowers.

The Circle of Life. Taulmir is eternal and ever-living. While holding the bow, you can use an action to transform it into a plain-looking seed that is impervious to damage. If you plant this seed in dirt or sand and then water it, it sprouts a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu] (CR 9) that is friendly to you after 1 minute. The treant holds Taulmir in its branches and will hand it back to you if asked. Once it gives you the bow, the treant transforms into an ordinary tree as its spirit returns to Otherwood.

Massive Fluffy Spider Egg.name: Massive Fluffy Spider Egg
Massive Fluffy Spider Egg.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary

This human-sized egg is covered in a fluffy, wool-like substance. As it gets closer to Spidermas, you can hear rumbling sounds coming out of it, and the egg sometimes trembles when touched. After it hatches, the massive fluffy baby spider likes to follow you around and will attempt to play harmless pranks with its webs on you and your companions. It requires sixteen times as much food and water as a medium-sized creature each day.

With care and nurture, the massive fluffy baby spider grows into an @UUID[Compendium.orelyns-opus-of-outstanding-objects.actors.Actor.tp0mAnhghW3Ovd2l] (CR 8) after two years. This enormous wooly spider is friendly to you and your companions. It will happily carry friendly creatures, as well as equipment up to its carrying capacity, holding everything in its thick wool. Unless trained to fight, it tries to pick up you and your companions on its huge back and run away from any perceived danger as soon as combat begins. It typically does not attack unless trained to, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Swiftwing Steed Armor.name: Swiftwing Steed Armor
Swiftwing Steed Armor.description:
Armor (plate), very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted for defiant heroes who oppose cruel angels and other evil celestial creatures, this armor allows ironclad paladins to fly and hover weightlessly in pursuit of their corrupt quarries.

This armor magically adjusts to fit on any Large or smaller mount, including rare animals, summoned steeds, aquatic mounts, and flying mounts. Only willing creatures that can serve as rideable mounts can attune to it.

While a mount wears this armor, they can use a bonus action to cause it to manifest a pair of spectral eagle wings. While the wings are present, they have a flying speed equal to their walking speed and can hover. The wings last until they die, or until they dismiss them as a bonus action.

Smooth Spider Egg.name: Smooth Spider Egg
Smooth Spider Egg.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This head-sized egg is silky-smooth to the touch. As it gets closer to Spidermas, you can hear screeching noises coming out of it. After it hatches, the smooth baby spider likes to skitter around and climb on walls. It requires as much food and water as a medium-sized creature each day.

With care and nurture, the smooth baby spider grows into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.f9JbhBfWucrY2eDA] (CR 1/4) after 60 days. This giant wolf spider is friendly to you and your companions. It likes to follow you anywhere you go and rub up against your legs to get your attention. Unless trained to fight, it tries to avoid combat by climbing up walls or hiding in crevices, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Rope of the Succubus.name: Rope of the Succubus
Rope of the Succubus.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope smells of roses and is remarkably supple to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle enchantment magic.

Any creature that attempts to untie, burst, or otherwise tamper with the rope must first succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or waste their action enjoying the softness of the rope and its pleasant smell.

Mask of Comedy and Mask of Tragedy.name: Mask of Comedy and Mask of Tragedy
Mask of Comedy and Mask of Tragedy.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare (requires attunement)

Myth has it that the earliest bards in recorded history used the original Mask of Comedy and Mask of Tragedy to perform in ancient plays. Since then, many magical performers have sought to create their own pair and several exist across the world.

While wearing the Mask of Comedy, you have advantage on Charisma checks related to performing in comedies and telling funny stories. While wearing the Mask of Tragedy, you have advantage on Charisma checks related to performing in tragedies and telling sad stories.

Masks of comedy and tragedy come in pairs. If one of the masks in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical. Each mask can be attuned to one creature at a time. A creature attuning to both masks uses a single attunement slot to do so.

Thousand Faces. While wearing one of the masks, you can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv] spell from it at will. When cast from the Mask of Tragedy, disguise self can create only tragic disguises that look perpetually sad and dramatic. When cast from the Mask of Comedy, disguise self can create only comedic disguises that look perpetually cheerful and funny. The spell ends if the mask is removed.

Theatrical Telepathy. While attuned to one of the masks, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD] spell at will, targeting the creature who is attuned to the other mask. To do so, both you and the creature must wear the masks.

Solar Aegis.name: Solar Aegis
Solar Aegis.description:
Armor (shield), legendary (requires attunement)

Forged for a defiant paladin general who waged war on corrupt angels in ages past, this shield allows you to withstand the fury of the sun itself.

While holding this shield, you have a +3 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. Additionally, you have resistance to fire and radiant damage, and you can't be blinded by bright light.

Radiant Reign. The shield has 5 charges. When you take fire or radiant damage, you can use your reaction and spend one charge to gain immunity to both fire and radiant damage, including against the triggering damage, until the end of your next turn. The shield regains 1d4 + 1 charges daily at dawn.

Radiant Reign.name: Radiant Reign
Radiant Reign.condition: when you take fire or radiant damage

Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Dormant).name: Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Dormant)
Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Dormant).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer)

Crafted by a sorcerer of supreme prowess, this morphing outfit appears to be made of a multicolored shimmering silk and can take the form of any outfit the wearer desires. Its true power has since lain dormant, waiting for someone worthy to release its potential.

Dormant. While wearing the outfit in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv] at will.
  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

Empowered (level 11). After you reach level 11, the artifact becomes empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You have a swimming, climbing, and flying speed equal to your walking speed while wearing this outfit.
  • This outfit gains a number of charges equal to your Charisma modifier. You can spend 5 feet of movement and one charge to automatically escape restraints, or end an effect that reduces your speed or causes you to be grappled, paralyzed, restrained, or stunned. You can escape multiple restraints and end multiple effects, expending 5 feet of movement and one charge of this feature per effect. You regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

Supreme (level 17). After you reach level 17, the outfit evolves into its supreme state, gaining the following additional properties:

  • Your Charisma score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You can ignore the verbal and somatic components of spells you cast.
  • When you use the Subtle Spell Metamagic feature, you can also ignore any material component that has no gold cost.
  • You can use your action to gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN] spell. This effect can be active for up to an hour, all at once or in shorter intervals of a minimum of 1 minute for the duration. This time limit resets daily at dawn.

Staff of the Aspirant.name: Staff of the Aspirant
Staff of the Aspirant.description:
Staff, uncommon (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

Given to apprentice spellcasters by their masters as a sign of trust and a test of arcane aptitude, a Staff of the Aspirant is often the first magic item a mage-in-training will obtain.

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls.

The staff has 5 charges and regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff retains its +1 bonus to attack and damage roll but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regains one charge.

Spells. While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs] (1 charge), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ODhLKBxLnvvLOnw1] (1 charge).

Armor of the Midnight Sun.name: Armor of the Midnight Sun
Armor of the Midnight Sun.description:
Armor (medium or heavy, but not hide), legendary (requires attunement)

First worn by a legendary hero who destroyed a menacing shadow dragon in service of Nelchior, the warring god of night and dark secrets, this armor has been infused with the power of the Eternal Light, allowing its wearer to see the unseen and pierce the heart of the night with pure sunlight.

While you wear this armor, you can use an action to cause it to shed bright light in a 45-foot radius and dim light for an additional 45 feet. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the armor's bright light. You can use a bonus action to end this effect. This light is sunlight.

Dawn's Fury. When you are hit with an attack while wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to cause the armor to flash with blinding sunlight in a 30-foot radius. Any creature in this light excluding you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 8d8 radiant damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded by this effect. Undead creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Foundry Note

This item functions as a magical item template. You can create a magic item by dragging one of the effects off this sheet and onto another item.

First open the item, change to the Effects tab, and drag the effect onto your item. This will apply the enchantment, add activities and other effects, and update the item's description and other properties with all the needed information.

If you want to revert the changes to the item, you can then simply remove the enchantment.

Potion of Bottled Language (Standard).name: Potion of Bottled Language (Standard)
Potion of Bottled Language (Standard).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

Prized by merchants and diplomats alike, these potions have been infused with the concentrated essence of a language. Different potions for different languages exist, and potions infused with exotic or dead languages are often more expensive than potions of more common languages.

When you drink this potion, you can magically speak, read, and write the language whose essence the potion includes for 1 hour.

This potion's color may vary depending on language and dialect, but all variants have tiny translucent letters floating in them. Shaking the bottle momentarily combines the letters into random words of the language it includes.

If you drink one potion of the same bottled language every day for 30 days, you permanently learn to read and write that language.

Linguistic Intoxication. If you drink a Potion of Bottled Language while still under the effects of another Potion of Bottled Language you must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or become linguistically intoxicated for 1 hour. While linguistically intoxicated, you feel light-headed and your speech is slurred; and you can only speak, read, and write only the languages of the potions that currently affect you.

Belt of Elvenkind.name: Belt of Elvenkind
Belt of Elvenkind.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Nobles from the elven nation of Khemhotep customarily gave these belts to trusted therianthrope servants and allies of non-elven lineage, aiming to help them see the elven point of view. While wearing this belt you gain the following benefits:

  • Your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with elves.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of your beard falling off if you have one.

If you aren't an elf, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
  • You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
  • You can speak, read, and write Elvish.

Tabal, the Truth of Lod.name: Tabal, the Truth of Lod
Tabal, the Truth of Lod.description:
Weapon (glaive), artifact (requires attunement)

Crafted by Lod the Entropian Emperor, an elder one who ruled over mortalkind ages ago, this weapon of mythical power was a symbol of trust between Lod and the mortals who served them most fervently.

After Lod's fall and the rise of a new pantheon, one of Lod's surviving progeny hid this weapon away until such time as a mortal would rise and challenge the impudent gods who dared to strike the Entropian Emperor down.

You gain a +4 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. It functions as a Weapon of Warning, deals an extra 1d10 force damage to any target it hits, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

Rift Slash. This weapon has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to spend one charge and create a momentary rift in the fabric of time and space in a 240-foot line that is 10 feet wide in front of you. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw, taking 8d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save are also knocked prone. Objects and structures in that line take double damage. The weapon regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lod's Whispers. While attuned to this weapon, you can hear Lod's whispers in your mind from across time and space. You can speak Deep Speech, you have advantage on all Intelligence (Arcana) and Wisdom (Insight) checks, and you magically know when someone speaks a willing lie in your presence. Hostile aberrations are indifferent toward you and indifferent aberrations are friendly toward you unless you threaten or harm them first.

Random Properties. Tabal, the Truth of Lod has the following randomly determined properties:

  • 1 minor beneficial property
  • 1 major beneficial property
  • 1 minor detrimental property
  • 1 major detrimental property

Water Fragment.name: Water Fragment
Water Fragment.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

While attuned to this fragment, you have resistance to cold damage, you can breathe air and water, and you have a swimming speed of 30 feet. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Aquan, and you can cast the water shape cantrip at will.

Awakened Water Fragment. Attuning to the Water Fragment while also attuned to the Shattered Staff awakens the fragment and it magically merges with the staff, becoming one item that takes up a single attunement slot. After the Water Fragment has been awakened, the following spells are added to the staff's spell list: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RpKjTlYASrfqUPVA] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7fFHlBk3UNX8gPKL] (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fzZnVKLmBMo2f5up] (6 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.YBda6nLKjxdT1LbS] (3 charges).

Net of the Basilisk.name: Net of the Basilisk
Net of the Basilisk.description:
Weapon (Net), Uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels rough to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle transmutation magic and woven into a net.

Any creature that knows the net's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to turn it into stone. The net remains in this petrified state for 24 hours, or until @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] is cast on it. The petrified net has AC 20 and 30 hit points. It can be burst with a DC 25 Strength check.

Rope of the Basilisk.name: Rope of the Basilisk
Rope of the Basilisk.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels rough to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle transmutation magic.

Any creature that knows the rope's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to turn it into stone. The rope remains in this petrified state for 24 hours, or until @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] is cast on it. The petrified rope has AC 20 and 30 hit points. It can be burst with a DC 25 Strength check.

Bident of True Death.name: Bident of True Death
Bident of True Death.description:
Weapon (spear), artifact (requires attunement)

Myth has it that this magic bident once belonged to an ancient deity that guided mortal souls to the realm of the dead. As eons passed and new gods arose, the bident fell into the hands of mortals.

Throughout history, heroes wielded the bident to protect their realms from undead hordes, while villains leveraged its power to utterly vanquish their foes.

This indestructible bident grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack using it, the target takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage.

True Death. Any creature that has been killed by the Bident of True Death can't become undead and can be restored to life only by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell.

Mastery over Death. While wielding the Bident of True Death, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dmvaMLFWFtv0qx0S] from it. This property can't be used again until 30 days have passed or until you have slain a mighty undead foe (CR 15 or higher).

Undead Bane. Undead creatures can only regain hit points lost to the bident's damage through a long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Undead creatures are destroyed if the bident's damage reduces their hit points to 0.

Amulet of a Thousand Voices.name: Amulet of a Thousand Voices
Amulet of a Thousand Voices.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare

Created by a legendary drag queen bard who sought to sing in every voice, this amulet allows anyone to perfectly mimic the speech of countless different persons.

A Thousand Voices. While wearing this amulet and you hear another person speaking, you can use your action to copy that person's voice in the amulet. You can use a bonus action to cause the amulet to change your voice to perfectly mimic any copied voice as long as you know it has been copied by the amulet. You can use another bonus action to use another copied voice or end this effect.

The amulet is rumored to be able to hold a thousand different copied voices. Many sages believe this figure to be exaggerated, while some believe the amulet could potentially hold every voice in existence, but no person has been able to verify this yet.

Realness. A copied voice by this amulet is indistinguishable from the original in terms of articulation, texture, timbre, and tone. The amulet envelops whoever wears it in a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by detect magic.

Hoarseness Immunity. While wearing this amulet, your voice cannot become hoarse due to disease, overuse, or magic.

Copy Voice.name: Copy Voice
Copy Voice.condition: when you hear another person speaking

The Divider (Perfected).name: The Divider (Perfected)
The Divider (Perfected).description:
Weapon (greataxe), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

When the royal geomancers foresaw the downfall of Underking Varadun, the last defiant ruler of the deep dwarves, the Underking challenged the demigod Rolim the Technurge to arm his strongest defenders with weapons so powerful that could fight fate itself. Accepting the challenge, the Technurge opened his timeless vault and bestowed fabled weapons upon the Underking's defenders, and then toiled over his enchanted anvil to create the Divider, a new artifact of mythical power for the Underking's mightiest champion.

Yet it was treachery that brought about the kingdom's downfall as the champion turned the Divider against the Underking and seized the crown, plunging the realm into chaos. The Technurge watched in horror as his creations became instruments of betrayal and even sought to intervene, violating ancient pacts that forbade him from taking sides in wars between mortals. But not even a demigod could alter the kingdom's fate. Disappointed and embittered, the Technurge condemned the new kingdom and broke the ancient pacts, claiming back his dangerous gifts and sealing them into his timeless vault once again.

Tempered. While attuned to this weapon, it has the following properties:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greataxe.
  • The weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage and deals double damage to objects and structures.
  • You can't be disarmed of this weapon unless you are incapacitated.
  • You must eat and drink twice the normal amount each day.

Sharpened (level 11). After you reach level 11, the greataxe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
  • Attacks with The Divider instantly destroy magical barriers, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb].
  • Your appetite grows. You must eat and drink five times the normal amount each day.

Perfected (level 17). After you reach level 17, the greataxe achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
  • When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the gamemaster decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.
  • Your appetite is as legendary as your axe. You must eat and drink ten times the normal amount each day.

Sound Whip.name: Sound Whip
Sound Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by a legendary storm sorceress who channeled some of her overflowing magic into arcane relics, this whip harbors the shattering power of thunder.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a whip of pure sound to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of thunderous sonic waves, the Sound Whip has the light property.

When you attack with this weapon, a loud crack of thunder, audible from as far away as 1200 feet, emanates from it.

Sonic Lash. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals thunder damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal with it, as well as a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, that target takes an extra 2d8 thunder damage.

Deafening Strike. When you hit a creature with an attack with this whip, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[deafened] until the start of your next turn. Creatures made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Highforged Asterite Ring (1 arcane slot).name: Highforged Asterite Ring (1 arcane slot)
Highforged Asterite Ring (1 arcane slot).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary, highforged (1 arcane slot, requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Crafted from asterite, a rare and innately magical meteoric metal, this ring has been further imbued with enduring magic.

While wearing this ring, you can use a bonus action and roll 1d6 + 1. You gain a temporary spell slot of that level. This temporary spell slot lasts until it is used, until you finish a long rest, or until the next dawn. The ring can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Highforged. This item has 1 arcane slot fitted with a Blue Sapphire, granting it the following additional property:

  • One Blue Sapphire. When you fall while wearing this item, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.

Sun Whip.name: Sun Whip
Sun Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), rare (requires attunement)

Created by an eccentric vampire hunter of angelic ancestry to outsmart her elusive prey, this weapon produces a luminous whip made of pure radiance that can strike foes with the power of the blazing sun.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a luminous whip of pure light to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of pure radiance, the Sun Whip has the light property.

Luminous Lash. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

Radiant Reach. The luminous whip emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. Instead of a whip's regular reach, the Sun Whip allows you to attack any target within the 15-foot-radius sphere of bright light it emits.

Net of the Phoenix.name: Net of the Phoenix
Net of the Phoenix.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope is slightly warm to the touch and smells of sulfur. The rope has been infused with subtle evocation magic and woven into a net.

Any creature that knows the net's nature can use a bonus action and command it to burst into flames. The net instantly catches fire across its length. Any creatures touching the net take 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of their turns. The net burns for 1 minute and then crumbles to ash. Unless scattered, this ash reforms into the net after 24 hours.

Remarkable Rolling Pin.name: Remarkable Rolling Pin
Remarkable Rolling Pin.description:
Weapon (club), rare (requires attunement)

Crafted for a legendary halfling pastry chef who took up adventuring, this rolling pin has been used countless times to innovate the culinary arts and create delicious baked goods, but also to defend halfling caravans against raiders and roaming monsters.

The Remarkable Rolling Pin is a magic club that looks like and weighs as much as a regular wooden rolling pin. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Dominion over Dough. While attuned to the Remarkable Rolling Pin, you have advantage on any ability checks and saving throws related to preparing baked goods with it.

Freshly Baked Goodness. Any creature that eats a portion of freshly baked goods that have been prepared using this pin gains 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points. A creature can gain this benefit only once per long rest.

Euphoric Flattening. When you hit an ooze or any other creature with the amorphous trait with the Remarkable Rolling Pin, instead of dealing damage you can use the pin to magically flatten it. A flattened creature is pleasantly stunned for 1 minute and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, this stunning effect ends.

Staff of the Spellmaster (Slumbering Sag.name: Staff of the Spellmaster (Slumbering Sage)
Staff of the Spellmaster (Slumbering Sag.description:
Staff, evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

Myth has it that an ancient arcanist once unlocked the secrets of every spell known to mortalkind and became known as the Spellmaster. Highforged Shadow Dragon Scale Mail (3 a.name: Highforged Shadow Dragon Scale Mail (3 arcane slots)
Highforged Shadow Dragon Scale Mail (3 a.description:
Armor (scale mail), artifact, highforged (3 arcane slots, requires attunement)

Crafted from the scales of a dragon that embraced the shadows, this magic scale mail protects the wearer while imparting some of the dark power of shadow dragons to them. Mighty heroes might claim these scales from a shadow dragon they defeated. Rarely, shadow dragons might give their scales away willingly to mortals they deem worthy.

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, you have advantage on saving throws against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons, and you have resistance to necrotic damage.

Shadow Stealth. While you are in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Dragonsense. You can focus your senses as an action to magically discern the distance and direction to the closest shadow dragon within 30 miles of you. This special action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Highforged. This item has 3 arcane slots fitted with a Yellow Diamond and two Emeralds, granting it the following additional properties:

  • One Yellow Diamond. You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws.
  • Two Emeralds. You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage.

Air Fragment.name: Air Fragment
Air Fragment.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

While attuned to this fragment, you have resistance to lightning damage and you can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not incapacitated. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Auran, and you can cast the minor gust cantrip at will.

Awakened Air Fragment. Attuning to the Air Fragment while also attuned to the Shattered Staff awakens the fragment and it magically merges with the staff, becoming one item that takes up a single attunement slot. After the Air Fragment has been awakened, the following spells are added to the staff's spell list: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yfbK8gZqESlaoY5t] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8PJAsHmbu6UgDHC0] (5 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (3 charges).

Lotus of Oblivion.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary

Myth has it that a magic fruit exists that can cure any disease and heal any wound, but whose unimaginable taste can make anyone who eats it forget who they are.

Many have sought out the Lotus of Oblivion only to lose themselves in its otherworldly sweetness. Aspiring heroes who cannot resist the magic of the lotus soon abandon everything to spend their lives under a lotus tree and indulge in pleasure.

The Sweetest Fruit. You can spend one minute to eat a Lotus of Oblivion. Doing so grants you several benefits. You are cured of all diseases, poison, and any condition that lowers your hit point maximum.

You also regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 hit points each minute) and your severed body members, if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the magic of the lotus instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

Additionally, you gain inspiration and become immune to disease, poison, and being frightened. These benefits last for 24 hours.

Curse of the Lotophagus. Each time you eat a Lotus of Oblivion, there is a 10 percent cumulative chance that you will become cursed and magically addicted to its sweetness. While cursed, you forget your ideals and bonds, and you must consume at least one lotus every 24 hours or have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl], or similar effect ends the curse on you but does not reset the chance to become addicted again.

The Reaver.name: The Reaver
The Reaver.description:
Weapon (longbow), very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by a sinister demon lord for a dark hero who sold his soul for power, the Reaver is a terrifying weapon in the hands of a skilled archer.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Barbed Arrow. The Reaver has 2 charges. While attuned to this longbow, you can expend one of its charges and use the attack action to make a special ranged attack with a barbed arrow that is attached to a demonic chain.

This attack has a normal range of 50 feet and a long range of 100 feet. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

On hit, the barbed arrow is embedded into the target, dealing an extra 1d6 piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pulled to the longbow and impaled on its balance spike for an additional 2d6 piercing damage.

The Reaver regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Net of Sickness.name: Net of Sickness
Net of Sickness.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels uncomfortably moist and has a musty smell. The rope has been infused with subtle necromancy magic and woven into a net.

Any creature restrained by this net is also subjected to the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, a creature can't regain hit points.

Kaftan of the Four Winds (Tempestuous).name: Kaftan of the Four Winds (Tempestuous)
Kaftan of the Four Winds (Tempestuous).description:
Armor (studded leather), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

Crafted by a primordial air elemental lord in ages past, the Kaftan of the Four Winds was a gift to a mortal hero who used newfound magic to defend ancient elementals from a host of corrupted celestial creatures.

Millennia later, the kaftan was forcefully removed from a temple of elemental magic and presented as a gift to an ambitious mortal king who sought to extend his dominion over dragonkind. After the king's demise by the claws of elder dragons, the kaftan was lost and its magic has lain dormant since, waiting for a worthy hero to unlock its true power once more.

Breezy. While wearing the armor, you gain the following benefits:

  • The armor grants you a +1 bonus to AC.
  • When you fall while wearing this armor, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.
  • You suffer no harm in temperatures as cold as -20 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit while wearing this armor.
  • You can cast the minor gust cantrip at will.

Gusty (level 5). After you reach level 5, the armor increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +2.
  • You can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O] spell on yourself at will.
  • The Kaftan of the Four Winds gains 10 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC, spellcasting ability modifier, and spell attack bonus: devil of dust (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (3 charges), or wind ward (2 charges). The kaftan regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Turbulent (level 11). After you reach level 11, the armor is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +3.
  • You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 20 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: wind control (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8PJAsHmbu6UgDHC0] (6 charges), and wind investiture (6 charges).

Tempestuous (level 17). After you reach level 17, the armor achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You are immune to damage from any spells you cast from this item.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 30 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZPd73HtKF3At11jh] (8 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7KjExw0kmuqERa7C] (9 charges).
  • If you are reduced to 0 hit points or subjected to an effect that would kill you instantly, you remain at 0 hit points and transform, along with everything you are wearing and carrying, into a living storm instead of falling unconscious. While in this form, you have a flying speed of 300 feet; immunity to all damage and conditions, and to any effects that would kill you instantly; and advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. If air can pass through a space, you can do so without squeezing. You can't attack, and the only spells you can cast are spells from this item. When casting spells from the kaftan while in this form, you expend no charges to do so. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, after which you suffer 4 levels of exhaustion and revert to your normal form with 1 hit point. This property can't be triggered again until 30 days have passed.

Halfling Chocolate Coins (Platinum).description:

Crafted by master halfling chefs, these beautifully minted coins are prized by adventurers, coin collectors, and gourmands who realize their true value.

A halfling chocolate coin looks, weighs, and feels like a regular coin in mint condition with depictions of halfling heroes on one side, and farm animals on the other. However, when placed in a creature's mouth, it melts into delicious and magically nourishing chocolate. The coin emits a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]. An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH] spell reveals its true nature.

Culinary Currency. Two varieties of Halfling Chocolate Coins exist. A gold chocolate coin tastes like milk chocolate and provides enough nourishment to sustain a medium-sized creature for one day. A platinum chocolate coin tastes like white chocolate and provides enough nourishment to sustain a medium-sized creature for ten days.

Legal Tender Fondue. Halfling Chocolate Coins never go bad. If they are broken, crushed, pierced, or submitted to heat or other conditions that would melt nonmagical metal coins, they turn into delicious chocolate fondue and are destroyed.

The Divider (Tempered).name: The Divider (Tempered)
The Divider (Tempered).description:
Weapon (greataxe), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

When the royal geomancers foresaw the downfall of Underking Varadun, the last defiant ruler of the deep dwarves, the Underking challenged the demigod Rolim the Technurge to arm his strongest defenders with weapons so powerful that could fight fate itself. Accepting the challenge, the Technurge opened his timeless vault and bestowed fabled weapons upon the Underking's defenders, and then toiled over his enchanted anvil to create the Divider, a new artifact of mythical power for the Underking's mightiest champion.

Yet it was treachery that brought about the kingdom's downfall as the champion turned the Divider against the Underking and seized the crown, plunging the realm into chaos. The Technurge watched in horror as his creations became instruments of betrayal and even sought to intervene, violating ancient pacts that forbade him from taking sides in wars between mortals. But not even a demigod could alter the kingdom's fate. Disappointed and embittered, the Technurge condemned the new kingdom and broke the ancient pacts, claiming back his dangerous gifts and sealing them into his timeless vault once again.

Tempered. While attuned to this weapon, it has the following properties:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greataxe.
  • The weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage and deals double damage to objects and structures.
  • You can't be disarmed of this weapon unless you are incapacitated.
  • You must eat and drink twice the normal amount each day.

Sharpened (level 11). After you reach level 11, the greataxe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
  • Attacks with The Divider instantly destroy magical barriers, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb].
  • Your appetite grows. You must eat and drink five times the normal amount each day.

Perfected (level 17). After you reach level 17, the greataxe achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
  • When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the gamemaster decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.
  • Your appetite is as legendary as your axe. You must eat and drink ten times the normal amount each day.

Rope of Truth.name: Rope of Truth
Rope of Truth.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope has thin strands of gold woven along its length. The rope has been infused with subtle divination magic.

The rope glows golden yellow whenever a creature that is restrained by it speaks a deliberate lie.

Orb of the Chronomancer.name: Orb of the Chronomancer
Orb of the Chronomancer.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Crafted by an ancient wizard who mastered the secrets of time itself, the Orb of the Chronomancer allows spellcasters to transcend the limitations of the time stop spell.

Chronomancy. While attuned to the orb, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JYuRBwxpoFhXduvD] from it. Once time stop has been cast through the orb, it can't be cast again until the next dawn.

Mastery of Time. When casting time stop, you can choose how many turns to take in a row (maximum of 5) instead of rolling 1d4 + 1 turns.

Temporal Anchor. While attuned to this orb, you are unaffected by time stop cast by other creatures and can act normally during their extra turns.

Greater Void Blade.name: Greater Void Blade
Greater Void Blade.description:
Weapon (longsword), legendary (requires attunement)

This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure darkness to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the Greater Void Blade.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals necrotic damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a humanoid with it, that target takes an extra 2d8 necrotic damage.

Bag of Spiderlings.name: Bag of Spiderlings
Bag of Spiderlings.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

This luxurious bag is actually an extradimensional spiderling paradise. Its interior is a divinely designed spider palace that can comfortably house a thousand baby spiders. The spiderlings live in luxury. The bag provides them with as much air, food, and drink as they need while keeping them young for as long as they stay in. When found, a Bag of Spiderlings will typically hold about a thousand baby spiders. Unlike lesser bags, the Bag of Spiderlings is indestructible.

Pick a Spiderling. As an action, you can reach inside the bag and pick a spiderling. Alternatively, you can use your action to place a spiderling in the bag.

Arachnid Flood. As an action, you can turn the bag inside out, releasing all thousand spiderlings in a 30-foot-radius sphere of baby spiders. This arachnid flood persists for one round as spiderlings tumble and fall, heavily obscuring the area. The ground in a 30-foot-radius circle becomes difficult terrain as spiderlings scurry about.

The spiderlings also cling on every surface within the area, creating thick, sticky webs after 3d6 rounds. If there are at least two solid masses (such as walls or trees) within the original 30-foot-radius sphere, the webs cover the entire sphere. Otherwise, the webs cover a 30-foot-radius circle on the ground with a depth of 5 feet. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free. A creature restrained by the webs can use its action to make a DC 12 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained.

The webs have AC 10, 15 hit points, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and psychic damage.

Library of the Blue Candles (Supreme).name: Library of the Blue Candles (Supreme)
Library of the Blue Candles (Supreme).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement)

The Library of the Blue Candles is a legendary repository of arcane knowledge hidden between dimensions, accessible through a scholar's robe. Underking Galdruman, Sage-King of the deep dwarves, was said to have the most extensive collection of rare tomes in his personal library, the secret Library of the Blue Candles.

In the aftermath of a violent uprising, the Sage-King fled into exile and those who usurped his power sought to discover the location of the library to no avail. Underking Galdruman had taken his library with him, and the secret of its location was lost with his death.

Using powerful magic, the Sage-King had hidden his library in a pocket dimension that one could access through a well-crafted, robust, but seemingly unassuming scholar's robe. Now, whoever dons the robe once more can attempt to master that dimension and claim the knowledge contained within.

Dormant, First Wing. While wearing this robe in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 11 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4dSvfvTy2ZIJ3K4k], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3].
  • You can focus on the robe's magic for 1 minute to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles. When casting @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left. You can use this property without consequences a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus until the next dawn. Each time you use this property after you have used it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus before the next dawn, you and any other target of the plane shift spell gain 1d4 levels of exhaustion.

Additionally, attuning to the robe makes you the planar ruler of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's first wing, which includes the teleportation circle, the index, the secret lounge, and the central repository of knowledge.
  • You control planar travel to the library. You can designate which creatures can enter the library through planar travel and only creatures using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] or divine intervention can enter the library against your will. Portals created by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XbwGq5kDJNvAxNXV] spell can only open in the library if you allow them to.
  • While inside the library, you can use an action to summon any book that you know is in the library to your hands.
  • You may study a skill or a tool in the library as part of a long rest. Doing so gives you a +10 on a single ability check within the next day that is related to that skill or tool.

Empowered, Second Wing (Level 11). After you reach level 11, the robe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against illusion spells.
  • The robe functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf].
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following additional spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.gopnZvS0c2jD5FP8] (self only).
  • When you are hit by an attack or subjected to an effect that would damage you, you can use your reaction to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] targeting only yourself. When casting plane shift that way, you are transported to the Library of the Blue Candles and avoid all damage from the triggering attack or effect. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Additionally, your command over the Library of the Blue Candles grows, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's second wing, which includes the main library hall, the forbidden history section, the hidden office, the living quarters, the kitchen, and the mess hall.
  • You gain the power to influence the flow of time inside the library. You and any creatures you designate can gain the benefits of a short or a long rest by spending only half the time required while resting inside the library. Additionally, you can double or halve the duration of any spells cast within the library.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg] as part of a long rest, requiring no material components.

Supreme, Third Wing (Level 17). After you reach level 17, the robe achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You are immune to @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB] and any magical effects that reduce Intelligence.
  • Functioning as an enhanced @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf], the robe can now store up to 10 levels worth of spells at a time and it can store spells of all levels.
  • You can now use your action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles at will. When casting plane shift from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left.

Additionally, gain complete control of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's third and final wing, which includes the ritual room, the annex arcanum, and the spell compendium.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf] at will, requiring no spell components and no concentration. When cast that way, the DC for the spell's Charisma saving throw is 15 or your spell save DC, whichever is higher.
  • While inside the library's ritual room, you can perform a special ritual over the course of 1 hour, at the conclusion of which you speak the full title of a specific book and attempt to magically summon it to you. The nearest copy of that book that isn't held or carried instantly appears in your hands regardless of physical or planar distances. If another creature is holding or carrying the only copy of the book, or if the book is protected against teleportation or planar travel, performing that ritual does not transport the book to you, but instead you learn who the creature possessing the book is and roughly where the book is located at that moment.

Celestial Blinders.name: Celestial Blinders
Celestial Blinders.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

These blinders magically pairs with a specific set of either Armor of the Defiant Dawn or Armor of the Midnight Sun and makes a mount that wears it immune to the Luminous Retribution and Dawn's Fury effects of the armor they are paired with while the wearer of the armor rides the mount.

Vessel of Entropy.name: Vessel of Entropy
Vessel of Entropy.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], artifact

Myth has it that an ancient god defeated and bound an unmentionable evil in an indestructible vessel to protect mortals from its corrupting influence. As ages passed and the god slumbered, mortals found the vessel lying forgotten in an abandoned temple and sought to use its dark power.

Any creature can use their action to either open or close the vessel. While the vessel is open, the unmentionable evil bound within acts on an initiative count 20. On the vessel's turn, the gamemaster rolls on the table below to determine the effect it produces. All effects that directly affect creatures, affect all creatures in a radius of 60 feet centered on the vessel. Multiple effects may be active at once, and the vessel does not need to maintain concentration for any effects it produces. When the vessel is closed, any effects it produced while open remain active unless stated otherwise.

@Embed[Compendium.orelyns-opus-of-outstanding-objects.tables.RollTable.amgk56z4L5h6DAxw rollable]

Highforged Belt of Elvenkind (1 arcane s.name: Highforged Belt of Elvenkind (1 arcane slot)
Highforged Belt of Elvenkind (1 arcane s.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare, highforged (1 arcane slot, requires attunement)

Nobles from the elven nation of Khemhotep customarily gave these belts to trusted therianthrope servants and allies of non-elven lineage, aiming to help them see the elven point of view. While wearing this belt you gain the following benefits:

  • Your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with elves.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of your beard falling off if you have one.

If you aren't an elf, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
  • You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
  • You can speak, read, and write Elvish.

Highforged. This item has 1 arcane slot fitted with a Gem of Brightness, granting it the following additional property:

  • One Gem of Brightness. You can use an action to cause this item to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can use a bonus action to end this effect.

Cute Spider Egg.name: Cute Spider Egg
Cute Spider Egg.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], common

This fist-sized egg is pleasantly warm to the touch. As it gets closer to Spidermas, you can hear tiny clacking noises coming out of it. After it hatches, the cute baby spider likes to cling to your clothes and only climb off to feed on crumbs of food and tiny bugs if those are not available on your person.

With care and nurture, the cute baby spider grows into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.28gU50HtG8Kp7uIz] (CR 0) after 30 days. This spider is friendly to you and your companions. It will do its best to keep your equipment free from bugs. Unless trained to fight, it avoids combat and prefers to snuggle inside your backpack or in the folds of your clothes, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Kaftan of the Four Winds (Breezy).name: Kaftan of the Four Winds (Breezy)
Kaftan of the Four Winds (Breezy).description:
Armor (studded leather), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

Crafted by a primordial air elemental lord in ages past, the Kaftan of the Four Winds was a gift to a mortal hero who used newfound magic to defend ancient elementals from a host of corrupted celestial creatures.

Millennia later, the kaftan was forcefully removed from a temple of elemental magic and presented as a gift to an ambitious mortal king who sought to extend his dominion over dragonkind. After the king's demise by the claws of elder dragons, the kaftan was lost and its magic has lain dormant since, waiting for a worthy hero to unlock its true power once more.

Breezy. While wearing the armor, you gain the following benefits:

  • The armor grants you a +1 bonus to AC.
  • When you fall while wearing this armor, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.
  • You suffer no harm in temperatures as cold as -20 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit while wearing this armor.
  • You can cast the minor gust cantrip at will.

Gusty (level 5). After you reach level 5, the armor increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +2.
  • You can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O] spell on yourself at will.
  • The Kaftan of the Four Winds gains 10 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC, spellcasting ability modifier, and spell attack bonus: devil of dust (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (3 charges), or wind ward (2 charges). The kaftan regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Turbulent (level 11). After you reach level 11, the armor is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +3.
  • You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 20 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: wind control (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8PJAsHmbu6UgDHC0] (6 charges), and wind investiture (6 charges).

Tempestuous (level 17). After you reach level 17, the armor achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You are immune to damage from any spells you cast from this item.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 30 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZPd73HtKF3At11jh] (8 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7KjExw0kmuqERa7C] (9 charges).
  • If you are reduced to 0 hit points or subjected to an effect that would kill you instantly, you remain at 0 hit points and transform, along with everything you are wearing and carrying, into a living storm instead of falling unconscious. While in this form, you have a flying speed of 300 feet; immunity to all damage and conditions, and to any effects that would kill you instantly; and advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. If air can pass through a space, you can do so without squeezing. You can't attack, and the only spells you can cast are spells from this item. When casting spells from the kaftan while in this form, you expend no charges to do so. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, after which you suffer 4 levels of exhaustion and revert to your normal form with 1 hit point. This property can't be triggered again until 30 days have passed.

Spelleater Spellbook.name: Spelleater Spellbook
Spelleater Spellbook.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement by a wizard)

Ancient and powerful, the origins of the bizarre spellbook are shrouded in mystery. The Spelleater Spellbook is a semi-sentient magic book that seeks to devour spell scrolls and other spellbooks.

If you can attune to this item, you can use it as a spellbook and an arcane focus. The Spelleater Spellbook allows you to add new spells to it following the normal rules for copying spells, but if you attempt to erase a spell, the spellbook lashes at you, dealing 6d10 psychic damage and ending your attunement to it.

Devour Scroll. While holding this spellbook, you can use an action to place a spell scroll (wizard only) between the book's pages. The book squirms as it devours the scroll, copying the spell into its pages. This process takes 1d6 turns per level of the spell and costs no material components.

Spellbook Feast. When the Spelleater Spellbook comes into physical contact with another spellbook that is not held or carried, it begins to devour it and the spells it contains. Each spell devoured that way has a 50 - the spell's level percent chance to be copied into the Spelleater Spellbook. Spells not copied are lost when the Spelleater Spellbook finishes its feast and the other spellbook is destroyed. The feast takes 1d6 turns per level of each spell devoured, and copied spells costs no material components.

Yellow Pages. Rarely, the Spelleater Spellbook likes a spell it devours so much that it might choose to produce a special yellow page to copy it on. Spells copied on a yellow page are always prepared for you as long as you are attuned to the spellbook. Each time the spellbook copies a spell through the Devour Scroll or Spellbook Feast features, there is a 10 + the spell's level percent chance that the spell is copied on a yellow page.

Magical Meiosis. Every time the Spelleater Spellbook devours a new spell while having at least two spells copied on yellow pages, there is a 10 percent chance that it splits into two Spelleater Spellbooks that have no yellow pages. This process takes one hour during which the spellbook is unusable as it is too preoccupied with its reproduction. The spells that were written in the original Spelleater Spellbook are divided evenly between the two new spellbooks.

Bringing two Spelleater Spellbooks together causes them to purr happily and does not trigger any of the above features.

Greater Moon Whip.name: Greater Moon Whip
Greater Moon Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), legendary (requires attunement)

Created by a relentless hunter of evil lycanthropes, polymorphist criminals, and other shapechangers, this weapon produces a luminous whip made of pure moonlight that can reveal the true form of creatures that stalk the night.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a silvery whip of pale light to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of moonlight, the Greater Moon Whip has the light property.

Lunar Lash. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a shapechanger with it, that target takes an extra 2d8 radiant damage and instantly reverts to its original form.

Moonlit Revelation. When active, the Greater Moon Whip sheds moonlight, creating bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. While in its original form, a shapechanger can't assume a different form until it leaves the whip's light.

Lionhide Cloak.name: Lionhide Cloak
Lionhide Cloak.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Myth has it that an ancient hero once faced a legendary lion that was impervious to the weapons of mortals. The hero wrestled the lion with his bare hands and emerged victorious, using the beast's own claws to skin it and claim its hide. Now, the Lionhide Cloak is an enduring symbol of strength and bravery.

Lion's Endurance. You have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while you wear this cloak.

Lion's Strength. Your Strength score becomes 23 while you wear this cloak. If your Strength is already 23 or higher, the cloak increases your Strength score by 1 instead, up to a maximum of 30.

Lion's Bravery. You can't be frightened while you wear this cloak.

Shadow Dragon Scale Mail.name: Shadow Dragon Scale Mail
Shadow Dragon Scale Mail.description:
Armor (scale mail), very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted from the scales of a dragon that embraced the shadows, this magic scale mail protects the wearer while imparting some of the dark power of shadow dragons to them. Mighty heroes might claim these scales from a shadow dragon they defeated. Rarely, shadow dragons might give their scales away willingly to mortals they deem worthy.

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, you have advantage on saving throws against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons, and you have resistance to necrotic damage.

Shadow Stealth. While you are in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Dragonsense. You can focus your senses as an action to magically discern the distance and direction to the closest shadow dragon within 30 miles of you. This special action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Staff of the Life Herald.name: Staff of the Life Herald
Staff of the Life Herald.description:
Staff, artifact (requires attunement by a bard, cleric, or druid)

Myth has it that this staff once belonged to the ancient deity who first conceived medicine as a profession. Throughout history, legendary healers wielded the Staff of the Life Herald to heal entire armies, spare the dying, cure plagues, and even bring heroes back from the dead. However, a few greedy individuals across the ages have used the staff to gain political leverage and amass tremendous fortune from those in need of its magic.

Herald of Health. While attuned to this staff, you are immune to disease and poison, and have resistance to necrotic damage.

Life Magic. The staff has 20 charges. While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZU9d6woBdUP8pIPt] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uUWb1wZgtMou0TVP] (1 charge per spell level), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qcYitWoSMTnKkzM1] (6 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Pyzmm8R7rVsNAPsd] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9kGrFXnLiRg3Xnbo] (7 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO] (7 charges).

The staff regains 2d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff drains your own life force, aging you by 2d8 + 4 years and gaining as many charges. If you cannot age, or if you are immune to effects that would age you, the staff does not gain any charges on a roll of 1.

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2skfDtglk1mGrb3l], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.n4JDcFKe5ikzYmAc], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8zT7njvqbpXs4Cel].

Greater Sound Whip.name: Greater Sound Whip
Greater Sound Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), legendary (requires attunement)

Crafted by a legendary storm sorceress who channeled some of her overflowing magic into arcane relics, this whip harbors the shattering power of thunder.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a whip of pure sound to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of thunderous sonic waves, the Greater Sound Whip has the light property.

When you attack with this weapon, a loud crack of thunder, audible from as far away as 1200 feet, emanates from it.

Sonic Lash. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals thunder damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal with it, as well as a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, that target takes an extra 4d8 thunder damage.

Deafening Strike. When you hit a creature with an attack with this whip, that creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[deafened] for 1 minute. Creatures made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Highforged Longsword +1 (2 arcane slots).name: Highforged Longsword +1 (2 arcane slots)
Highforged Longsword +1 (2 arcane slots).description:
Weapon (longsword), very rare, highforged (2 arcane slots, requires attunement)

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Highforged. This item has 2 arcane slots fitted with two Red Corundums, granting it the following additional properties:

  • Two Red Corundums. This weapon deals an extra 1d6 fire damage to any target it hits. Additionally, instead of rolling dice for fire damage, you deal maximum fire damage when you score a critical hit with this weapon.

Rope of the Phoenix.name: Rope of the Phoenix
Rope of the Phoenix.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope is slightly warm to the touch and smells of sulfur. The rope has been infused with subtle evocation magic.

Any creature that knows the rope's nature can use a bonus action and command it to burst into flames. The rope instantly catches fire across its length. Any creatures touching the rope take 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of their turns. The rope burns for 1 minute and then crumbles to ash. Unless scattered, this ash reforms into the rope after 24 hours.

Halfling Chocolate Coins (Gold).name: Halfling Chocolate Coins (Gold)
Halfling Chocolate Coins (Gold).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], common

Crafted by master halfling chefs, these beautifully minted coins are prized by adventurers, coin collectors, and gourmands who realize their true value.

A halfling chocolate coin looks, weighs, and feels like a regular coin in mint condition with depictions of halfling heroes on one side, and farm animals on the other. However, when placed in a creature's mouth, it melts into delicious and magically nourishing chocolate. The coin emits a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]. An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH] spell reveals its true nature.

Culinary Currency. Two varieties of Halfling Chocolate Coins exist. A gold chocolate coin tastes like milk chocolate and provides enough nourishment to sustain a medium-sized creature for one day. A platinum chocolate coin tastes like white chocolate and provides enough nourishment to sustain a medium-sized creature for ten days.

Legal Tender Fondue. Halfling Chocolate Coins never go bad. If they are broken, crushed, pierced, or submitted to heat or other conditions that would melt nonmagical metal coins, they turn into delicious chocolate fondue and are destroyed.

Shattered Staff.name: Shattered Staff
Shattered Staff.description:
Staff, rare (zero fragments), (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

At a first glance, this staff looks like a broken relic, but arcane spellcasters can still use its remaining magic.

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

Spells. The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action or reaction (as determined by each spell's casting time and reaction trigger) to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: absorb elements (1 charge), chromatic sphere (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LWTUqKkUQdMAmOe0] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O] (2 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7] (1 charge).

The staff regains 1d8 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 1d4 + 1 charges.

Mysterious Sockets. The staff looks incomplete. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg] spell or divination magic of equal power can reveal the staff's true nature and offer hints and adventure hooks towards discovering the four missing elemental fragments.

Elemental Fragments. Four elemental fragments have splintered off the staff. When reunited with the staff, a fragment becomes awakened, merging with the staff and granting it its magic, as well as additional benefits. Awakened elemental fragments use the same attunement slot as the Shattered Staff, becoming a single item.

Each awakened elemental fragment grants the Shattered Staff the following benefits:

  • The staff's bonus to attack and damage rolls, as well as the bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls increases to +2, unless it's +2 already from another awakened fragment.
  • The staff gains 10 additional charges for every awakened elemental fragment, and extra spells are added to its spell list as specified in each fragment's description.
  • The staff regains an additional 1d8 + 2 expended charges per awakened fragment daily at dawn.
  • When you roll a d20 after having expended the last charge and get a 20 on the roll, the staff regains an additional 1d4 + 1 charges per awakened fragment.

When all four elemental fragments have been recovered, the Shattered Staff is transformed into the Staff of Elemental Mastery.

Number of Fragments: [[lookup @item.flags.world.shattered-staff.fragments]] / 4

Foundry Note

When you want to enhance the shattered staff with an awakened fragment, find the Enchantment effect on the fragment's item sheet, then drag it onto this staff. This will add the Cast activities, the modifications to the actor via an effect, and boost the relevant values on the staff.

Kaleidoscopic Lenses.name: Kaleidoscopic Lenses
Kaleidoscopic Lenses.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

Crafted by a legendary drag queen who sought freedom from a singular appearance, these lenses allow anyone to transform the color and the features of their eyes.

You can use your action to place the lenses directly on the surface of your eyes. Thereafter, the lenses can't be removed unless you detach them as an action or you die. Not even an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] causes them to fall off.

Kaleidoscopic Lenses typically come in pairs, but singular lenses also exist. If one lens in a pair is destroyed, the other continues to function. If you have more than two eyes, you can use additional Kaleidoscopic Lenses with no penalties.

Infinite Eyes. While wearing these lenses, you can use a bonus action to change the color of one or both your eyes, as well as any ocular features, including the shape and the size of your pupil and iris. If you have more than two eyes, you can change as many of your eyes as you wish, choosing the same or different appearance for any of them.

You can choose a different appearance for each eye with the same bonus action, and you can use another bonus action to return some or all of your eyes to their normal appearance.

Realness. Unless you purposefully wear the Kaleidoscopic Lenses so their nature is obvious, eyes changed by the Kaleidoscopic Lenses are indistinguishable from real eyes. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell can reveal the lenses' true nature while worn. The lenses envelop whoever wears them in a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8].

Makeup Protection. While wearing these lenses, your eyes cannot tear up unless you wish so.

Moonglass Ring.name: Moonglass Ring
Moonglass Ring.description:
