[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Crafted in a rare collaboration between a moon elf sage and a group of deep dwarf explorers, this ring has been forged with ancient deep dwarven techniques and imbued with pure moonlight.

While wearing this ring, you can use a bonus action and roll 1d4 + 1. You gain a temporary spell slot of that level. This temporary spell slot lasts until it is used, until you finish a long rest, or until the next dawn. The ring can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Greater Combat Measuring Tape.name: Greater Combat Measuring Tape
Greater Combat Measuring Tape.description:
Weapon (whip, dagger, shortsword, or longsword), legendary (requires attunement)

Crafted by combat-ready technognome artificers, this item appears to be a measuring tape with an ergonomic hilt. It is an upgrade for the regular Combat Measuring Tape. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a metal strip with measurement markings to extend out of the hilt up to its maximum length of 15 feet, adjust the strip's extended length, or make the strip disappear. While the strip is extended, you can use it to measure lengths or distances of up to its extended length or use it as a weapon.

You decide the Combat Measuring Tape's weapon type depending on how much you choose to extend its metal strip. Regardless of weapon type, the Combat Measuring Tape always has the finesse and light properties. The tape can be used as a dagger that lacks the thrown property, as a shortsword, as a longsword that lacks the versatile property, or as a whip that adds 10 feet to your reach when you attack with it, instead of 5.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the Combat Measuring Tape when used as a weapon, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

Maracas of Mauling.name: Maracas of Mauling
Maracas of Mauling.description:
Weapon (mace), very rare (requires attunement)

Valued by brawling bards and musically inclined warriors alike, these two magic maracas are also powerful maces.

The Maracas of Mauling can be used as musical instruments and as maces. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with each of them.

Maracas of Mauling come in pairs. If one of the maracas in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical. A creature can attune to both maracas or two creatures can attune to one maraca each. A creature attuning to both maracas uses a single attunement slot to do so.

Dance of Doom. While wielding both Maracas of Mauling, you can use a bonus action to burst into the Dance of Doom, which is audible from as far away as 300 feet and lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated or if you drop both maracas. You can also finish the Dance of Doom at any time (no action required).

While you're doing the Dance of Doom, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks to dance, sing, and play the maracas.
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • Melee attacks with the Maracas of Mauling deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage.
  • When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to perform a series of defensive dance moves. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +3 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

Once finished, the Dance of Doom can't be danced again until the next dawn.

Extended Dance of Doom

At the gamemaster's discretion, a creature may continue doing the Dance of Doom until they become exhausted. After doing the Dance of Doom for 1 minute, a creature wishing to continue to dance must make a [[/save con 10]] saving throw. On a success, the creature can continue to dance for 1 additional minute. On a failure, the creature stops dancing, gains 1 level of exhaustion, and falls prone. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw may choose to continue extending the dance. The DC of the Constitution saving throw increases by 5 each time the creature attempts to extend the dance by 1 more minute.

Shuffleflush's Stinky Shoes.name: Shuffleflush's Stinky Shoes
Shuffleflush's Stinky Shoes.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Once worn by the legendary halfling gambler Shiny Shuffleflush, these fancy shoes are always magically clean and spotless. Stories say that Shuffleflush used the magic of these shoes to get other gamblers to leave the table whenever fortune did not favor him.

While wearing these shoes, your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

Summon Stupefying Stink. While wearing these shoes, you are enveloped in a pleasant, musky aroma. However, you can use your action to cause them to emit a terrible odor, as if you had cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TwlD4PLcltv7Xh7j] (DC 25) centered on yourself and not requiring concentration. You can trigger this effect at will and you automatically succeed on its saving throw.

Shuffleflush's Stinky Salvation. Any creature that swallows you while you are wearing these shoes must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw against poison or be forced to regurgitate you immediately as the shoes' magical stink automatically seeps out and overwhelms it. The creature repeats the saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns for as long as you remain swallowed. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

Swiftwing Armor.name: Swiftwing Armor
Swiftwing Armor.description:
Armor (plate), very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted for defiant heroes who oppose cruel angels and other evil celestial creatures, this armor allows ironclad paladins to fly and hover weightlessly in pursuit of their corrupt quarries.

While you wear this armor, you can use a bonus action to cause it to manifest a pair of spectral eagle wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. The wings last until you die, or until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

Net of Truth.name: Net of Truth
Net of Truth.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope has thin strands of gold woven along its length. The rope has been infused with subtle divination magic and woven into a net.

The net glows golden yellow whenever a creature that is restrained by it speaks a deliberate lie.

Combat Measuring Tape.name: Combat Measuring Tape
Combat Measuring Tape.description:
Weapon (whip, dagger, shortsword, or longsword), rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by combat-ready technognome artificers, this item appears to be a measuring tape with an ergonomic hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a metal strip with measurement markings to extend out of the hilt up to its maximum length of 15 feet, adjust the strip's extended length, or make the strip disappear. While the strip is extended, you can use it to measure lengths or distances of up to its extended length or use it as a weapon.

You decide the Combat Measuring Tape's weapon type depending on how much you choose to extend its metal strip. Regardless of weapon type, the Combat Measuring Tape always has the finesse and light properties. The tape can be used as a dagger that lacks the thrown property, as a shortsword, as a longsword that lacks the versatile property, or as a whip that adds 10 feet to your reach when you attack with it, instead of 5.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the Combat Measuring Tape when used as a weapon.

Bag of Puppies.name: Bag of Puppies
Bag of Puppies.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

This charming bag is actually an extradimensional puppy paradise. Its interior is a divinely designed dog resort that can comfortably house a thousand puppies. The puppies live in luxury. The bag provides them with as much air, food, and drink as they need while keeping them young for as long as they stay in. When found, a Bag of Puppies will typically hold about a thousand puppies. Unlike lesser bags, the Bag of Puppies is indestructible.

Pick a Puppy. As an action, you can reach inside the bag and pick a @UUID[Compendium.orelyns-opus-of-outstanding-objects.actors.Actor.flMkYkUoe1hDUTp0]. Alternatively, you can use your action to place a puppy in the bag.

Canine Flood. As an action, you can turn the bag inside out, releasing all thousand puppies in a 30-foot-radius sphere of puppies. This canine flood persists for one round as puppies tumble and fall, heavily obscuring the area. The ground in a 30-foot-radius circle becomes difficult terrain as puppies scurry about. Any Medium or smaller creature that enters the circle for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there must succeed on a DC 15 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the creature chooses the ability to use and may willingly fail the save) or fall prone and become grappled (escape DC 15) as enthusiastic and playful puppies jump onto it. The circle lasts for 3d6 rounds, until the puppies get tired from all the play.

Staff of the Spellmaster (Awakened Arcan.name: Staff of the Spellmaster (Awakened Arcanist)
Staff of the Spellmaster (Awakened Arcan.description:
Staff, evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

Myth has it that an ancient arcanist once unlocked the secrets of every spell known to mortalkind and became known as the Spellmaster. Believing they had reached the apex of their power, the Spellmaster sought to channel all their arcane knowledge into an unbreakable staff and use it as a conduit to achieve immortality through a ritual of their own devise.

The ritual was successful, but along with all knowledge, the Spellmaster unintentionally channeled their own essence, soul, and magic into the staff, becoming one with it and leaving their mortal body behind.

Transformed into an ageless, unbreakable staff, the Spellmaster looked within for meaning and purpose, eventually falling into a deep, trance-like sleep that lasted for ages. Now, the ancient arcanist slumbers within the staff, waiting for a mage capable enough to rouse them from their sleep and awaken their true power.

Slumbering Sage. While attuned to this staff, you gain the following benefits:

  • While holding the staff, you can cast any spell you know or have prepared that's half your level (rounded down) without expending a spell slot. Once you cast a spell that way, you can't do so again until the next dawn.
  • When an enemy successfully casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] on you, only half of the spells active on you end automatically (minimum of one), and any ability checks to end spell effects on you against your will are made with disadvantage.

Awakened Arcanist (level 5). After you reach level 5, the staff increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
  • You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain concentration on spells.
  • The staff gains 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (3 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (3 charges). The staff regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Master Mage (level 11). After you reach level 11, the staff is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells increases to +2.
  • You gain a second reaction that you can only use to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy].
  • The staff's charges increase to 20 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (4th-level version, 4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (4th-level version, 4 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby] (6 charges).

Spellmaster Supreme (level 17). After you reach level 17, the staff achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells increases to +3.
  • The staff's charges increase to 50 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] (8 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (5th-level version, 5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (5th-level version, 5 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby] (7th-level version, 7 charges).
  • When casting a spell that requires concentration, you may use as many charges from the staff as that spell's level to make the staff maintain concentration on the spell for you so you can maintain concentration on another spell. The staff can only maintain concentration on one spell at a time and its concentration can be broken only if you drop the staff or if you die.

Sentience. The Staff of the Spellmaster is a sentient lawful neutral staff with an Intelligence of 30, a Wisdom of 13, and a Charisma of 8. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. It can communicate with its wielder telepathically. The staff knows Celestial, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, and Primordial, as well as any languages its wielder knows.

Personality. Having once been one of the strongest mortal mages alive, the Staff of the Spellmaster believes it's no mere item but a mentor who guides other mages to greatness. It will often comment on various spells and magical effects, expecting its words to be treated with respect.

Kaftan of the Four Winds (Turbulent).name: Kaftan of the Four Winds (Turbulent)
Kaftan of the Four Winds (Turbulent).description:
Armor (studded leather), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

Crafted by a primordial air elemental lord in ages past, the Kaftan of the Four Winds was a gift to a mortal hero who used newfound magic to defend ancient elementals from a host of corrupted celestial creatures.

Millennia later, the kaftan was forcefully removed from a temple of elemental magic and presented as a gift to an ambitious mortal king who sought to extend his dominion over dragonkind. After the king's demise by the claws of elder dragons, the kaftan was lost and its magic has lain dormant since, waiting for a worthy hero to unlock its true power once more.

Breezy. While wearing the armor, you gain the following benefits:

  • The armor grants you a +1 bonus to AC.
  • When you fall while wearing this armor, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.
  • You suffer no harm in temperatures as cold as -20 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit while wearing this armor.
  • You can cast the minor gust cantrip at will.

Gusty (level 5). After you reach level 5, the armor increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +2.
  • You can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O] spell on yourself at will.
  • The Kaftan of the Four Winds gains 10 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC, spellcasting ability modifier, and spell attack bonus: devil of dust (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (3 charges), or wind ward (2 charges). The kaftan regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Turbulent (level 11). After you reach level 11, the armor is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +3.
  • You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 20 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: wind control (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8PJAsHmbu6UgDHC0] (6 charges), and wind investiture (6 charges).

Tempestuous (level 17). After you reach level 17, the armor achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You are immune to damage from any spells you cast from this item.
  • The kaftan's charges increase to 30 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZPd73HtKF3At11jh] (8 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7KjExw0kmuqERa7C] (9 charges).
  • If you are reduced to 0 hit points or subjected to an effect that would kill you instantly, you remain at 0 hit points and transform, along with everything you are wearing and carrying, into a living storm instead of falling unconscious. While in this form, you have a flying speed of 300 feet; immunity to all damage and conditions, and to any effects that would kill you instantly; and advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. If air can pass through a space, you can do so without squeezing. You can't attack, and the only spells you can cast are spells from this item. When casting spells from the kaftan while in this form, you expend no charges to do so. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, after which you suffer 4 levels of exhaustion and revert to your normal form with 1 hit point. This property can't be triggered again until 30 days have passed.

Skycrystal Armor.name: Skycrystal Armor
Skycrystal Armor.description:
Armor (plate), artifact (requires attunement)

Forged by legendary giant blacksmiths in ages past and infused with the unending magic of creation, this suit of armor allows mortals a glimpse of true immortality.

While wearing this armor, you have a +3 bonus to AC and advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The Skycrystal Armor has 10 charges and regains 1d8 + 2 charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d10. On a 10, the armor regains 1d4 + 1 charges.

Spell Absorption. While wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to absorb a spell that is targeting only you. The armor absorbs the magic of the spell, canceling its effect and gaining a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level, up to the armor's maximum charges. If you are targeted by a spell that the armor can't store, the armor has no effect on that spell.

Spells. While wearing this armor, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: absorb elements (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby] (6 charges), invulnerability (9 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7] (1 charge).

Timelessness. While attuned to this armor, your body is unaffected by the passage of time. You stop aging, and any effects that would age you are suspended for you. If your attunement to the armor ends, these effects, including accumulated biological aging, affect you immediately.

Sack of Many Gifts.name: Sack of Many Gifts
Sack of Many Gifts.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

Made by a philanthropist who wanted to spread love and optimism to the world, this semi-sentient sack has been infused with divination and conjuration magic to magically create perfect gifts for those who have been nice and reveal those who have been naughty.

As an action, any creature can reach inside the sack and receive a gift from it. A creature of good or neutral alignment receives any item they might desire that costs no more than 100 gp. A creature of evil alignment receives a worthless lump of coal. Creatures immune to divination magic or effects that would sense their emotions or read their thoughts receive generic gifts such as a scented candle, a potted plant, a cheeseboard set, or a pair of fuzzy socks.

The sack can give gifts up to a total worth of 25,000 gp until it's empty. The sack magically refills on the eve of the winter solstice each year. Once a creature has received a gift from the sack, it cannot receive another one until the sack refills. Even when full, the sack never weighs more than 60 pounds.

Net of Vanishing.name: Net of Vanishing
Net of Vanishing.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope looks completely mundane and unremarkable. The rope has been infused with subtle illusion magic and woven into a net.

Any creature that knows the net's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to turn it invisible. The net remains invisible until it is cut, or until a creature that knows its nature touches it and uses another bonus action to make it visible again.

Gem of Darkness.name: Gem of Darkness
Gem of Darkness.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This prism has 50 Charges. While you are holding it, you can use an action to speak one of three command words to cause one of the following effects:

  • The first command word causes the gem to extinguish all nonmagical light and light created by uncommon items in a 60-foot radius. If any of this effect's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 1st level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled. This effect doesn't expend a charge.
  • The second command word expends 1 charge and causes the gem to create magical darkness that spreads from a point you choose within 60 feet of you to fill a 5-foot radius sphere for 1 minute or until you use the gem to create that effect again. The darkness spreads around corners and extinguishes all nonmagical light and light created by uncommon items. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If any of this effect's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.
  • The third command word expends 5 charges and allows you to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq] spell from the gem. When cast this way, darkness has a range of 120 feet and the sphere of magical darkness it creates has a radius of 20 feet.

When all of the gem's charges are expended, the gem becomes a nonmagical jewel worth 50 gp.

Net of the Succubus.name: Net of the Succubus
Net of the Succubus.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope smells of roses and is remarkably supple to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle enchantment magic and woven into a net.

Any creature that attempts to untie, burst, or otherwise tamper with the net must first succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or waste their action enjoying the softness of the net and its pleasant smell.

Belt of Humankind.name: Belt of Humankind
Belt of Humankind.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by ancient giant sages shortly after the rise of humankind, this belt was designed to help members of the elder races get closer to humans and understand their unusual ways.

While wearing this belt you gain the following benefits:

  • Two different ability scores of your choice increase by 1, to a maximum of 20. Once chosen, you gain the same two ability score increases whenever you attune to this item again.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with humans.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of waking up with mildly uncomfortable existential anxiety about the meaning of life and the ceaseless passage of time.

If you aren't a human, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same skill whenever you attune to this item again.
  • You gain one feat of your choice that does not have a racial prerequisite. Once chosen, you gain the same feat whenever you attune to this item again.
  • You can speak, read, and write Common.
Game Master Note

The ability scores and skill have been pre-selected. Please edit the effect on this item before granting it to a player.

Amulet of the First Paladins.name: Amulet of the First Paladins
Amulet of the First Paladins.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Worn by the ancient heroes who first rose up against the warring gods of Naam, these amulets were crafted to protect against divine influence. Blessed by Dysangelist Lethimus himself and handed down from hero to hero across the ages, nine of these amulets are believed to exist.

Protection from Gods. While attuned to this amulet, you are always under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aU62xVUBYkAQWIHv] and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xmDBqZhRVrtLP8h2] spells.

Freethinking. You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

Bracers of Gunnery.name: Bracers of Gunnery
Bracers of Gunnery.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon (requires attunement)

Technognome artificers give these bracers to their apprentices to help them learn how to use firearms, and seasoned artillerists and gunslingers use them to perfect their craft and gain an edge over their enemies.

While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with firearms, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

Vine Manacles.name: Vine Manacles
Vine Manacles.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare

Used by intrepid paladins of Nature who hunt down agents of destruction, these thorny restraints can bind any target of large size or smaller.

Escaping the Vine Manacles requires a successful DC 25 Dexterity check and breaking them requires a successful DC 25 Strength check.

Vine Manacles can't be unlocked, but they can be removed by the creature who placed them on the target. The manacles have 50 hit points. If they are damaged, they regain 1 hit point per minute. If the Vine Manacles are reduced to 0 hit points, they wither, leaving behind a spore. If the spore is planted on fertile soil, it will sprout a new set of Vine Manacles at the next dawn.

Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Supreme).name: Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Supreme)
Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Supreme).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer)

Crafted by a sorcerer of supreme prowess, this morphing outfit appears to be made of a multicolored shimmering silk and can take the form of any outfit the wearer desires. Its true power has since lain dormant, waiting for someone worthy to release its potential.

Dormant. While wearing the outfit in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv] at will.
  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

Empowered (level 11). After you reach level 11, the artifact becomes empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You have a swimming, climbing, and flying speed equal to your walking speed while wearing this outfit.
  • This outfit gains a number of charges equal to your Charisma modifier. You can spend 5 feet of movement and one charge to automatically escape restraints, or end an effect that reduces your speed or causes you to be grappled, paralyzed, restrained, or stunned. You can escape multiple restraints and end multiple effects, expending 5 feet of movement and one charge of this feature per effect. You regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

Supreme (level 17). After you reach level 17, the outfit evolves into its supreme state, gaining the following additional properties:

  • Your Charisma score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You can ignore the verbal and somatic components of spells you cast.
  • When you use the Subtle Spell Metamagic feature, you can also ignore any material component that has no gold cost.
  • You can use your action to gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN] spell. This effect can be active for up to an hour, all at once or in shorter intervals of a minimum of 1 minute for the duration. This time limit resets daily at dawn.

Moon Whip.name: Moon Whip
Moon Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), rare (requires attunement)

Created by a relentless hunter of evil lycanthropes, polymorphist criminals, and other shapechangers, this weapon produces a luminous whip made of pure moonlight that can reveal the true form of creatures that stalk the night.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a silvery whip of pale light to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of moonlight, the Moon Whip has the light property.

Lunar Lash. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a shapechanger with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage and instantly reverts to its original form.

Moonlit Revelation. When active, the Moon Whip sheds moonlight, creating bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. While in its original form, a shapechanger can't assume a different form until it leaves the whip's light.

Pegasus Cloak.name: Pegasus Cloak
Pegasus Cloak.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare (requires attunement)

While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to turn the cloak into a pair of magnificent pegasus wings. The wings give you a flying speed of 60 feet and last for an hour, or until you dismiss them with an action. When the wings disappear, you have to wait 1d6 hours before using them again.

Inner Pegasus. You can use your action to turn yourself into a Pegasus for 1 hour. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EIgAW1dWVPpyWLUh] (CR 2), but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Your gear melds into your new form and you can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from it. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Earth Fragment.name: Earth Fragment
Earth Fragment.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

While attuned to this fragment, you have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage; and you can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Terran, and you can cast the earth mold cantrip at will.

Awakened Earth Fragment. Attuning to the Earth Fragment while also attuned to the Shattered Staff awakens the fragment and it magically merges with the staff, becoming one item that takes up a single attunement slot. After the Earth Fragment has been awakened, the following spells are added to the staff's spell list: catapult object (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yI0XWIgI0IGGsR3R] (6 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kozNy29b0X6exFhY] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.QvGcdRUSNRKEQJlK] (4 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.NmoRmM1mhuM3pqnY] (5 charges).

Staff of the Pansophist.name: Staff of the Pansophist
Staff of the Pansophist.description:
Staff, legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

Few Fateweavers ever reach the rank of the Pansophist and any who do find themselves among an elite of wizards with vast magical resources and expansive political influence. A wizard reaching the rank of Pansophist within the Fateweavers is often entrusted with a Staff of the Pansophist or another staff of legendary power fit for the wizard's exalted status.

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

The staff has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains 4d6 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff loses power, becoming a Staff of the Observer with 10 charges. On a 20, the staff regains 1d12 + 1 charges.

Greater Fateweaving. Whenever a creature you can see makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can expend 1 or more charges, up to double your proficiency bonus, and add or subtract that number from the roll (no action required).

Spells. While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ImlCJQwR1VL40Qem] (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XqzXSKNR75ZdYTA9] (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.6HEEhLdJz32TL4Js] (9 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DQzlB5Y3k791W5bH] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] (5 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XzkJpE6XpZfKjODD] (6 charges).

Library of the Blue Candles (Dormant).name: Library of the Blue Candles (Dormant)
Library of the Blue Candles (Dormant).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement)

The Library of the Blue Candles is a legendary repository of arcane knowledge hidden between dimensions, accessible through a scholar's robe. Underking Galdruman, Sage-King of the deep dwarves, was said to have the most extensive collection of rare tomes in his personal library, the secret Library of the Blue Candles.

In the aftermath of a violent uprising, the Sage-King fled into exile and those who usurped his power sought to discover the location of the library to no avail. Underking Galdruman had taken his library with him, and the secret of its location was lost with his death.

Using powerful magic, the Sage-King had hidden his library in a pocket dimension that one could access through a well-crafted, robust, but seemingly unassuming scholar's robe. Now, whoever dons the robe once more can attempt to master that dimension and claim the knowledge contained within.

Dormant, First Wing. While wearing this robe in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 11 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4dSvfvTy2ZIJ3K4k], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3].
  • You can focus on the robe's magic for 1 minute to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles. When casting @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left. You can use this property without consequences a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus until the next dawn. Each time you use this property after you have used it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus before the next dawn, you and any other target of the plane shift spell gain 1d4 levels of exhaustion.

Additionally, attuning to the robe makes you the planar ruler of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's first wing, which includes the teleportation circle, the index, the secret lounge, and the central repository of knowledge.
  • You control planar travel to the library. You can designate which creatures can enter the library through planar travel and only creatures using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] or divine intervention can enter the library against your will. Portals created by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XbwGq5kDJNvAxNXV] spell can only open in the library if you allow them to.
  • While inside the library, you can use an action to summon any book that you know is in the library to your hands.
  • You may study a skill or a tool in the library as part of a long rest. Doing so gives you a +10 on a single ability check within the next day that is related to that skill or tool.

Empowered, Second Wing (Level 11). After you reach level 11, the robe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against illusion spells.
  • The robe functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf].
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following additional spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.gopnZvS0c2jD5FP8] (self only).
  • When you are hit by an attack or subjected to an effect that would damage you, you can use your reaction to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] targeting only yourself. When casting plane shift that way, you are transported to the Library of the Blue Candles and avoid all damage from the triggering attack or effect. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Additionally, your command over the Library of the Blue Candles grows, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's second wing, which includes the main library hall, the forbidden history section, the hidden office, the living quarters, the kitchen, and the mess hall.
  • You gain the power to influence the flow of time inside the library. You and any creatures you designate can gain the benefits of a short or a long rest by spending only half the time required while resting inside the library. Additionally, you can double or halve the duration of any spells cast within the library.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg] as part of a long rest, requiring no material components.

Supreme, Third Wing (Level 17). After you reach level 17, the robe achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You are immune to @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB] and any magical effects that reduce Intelligence.
  • Functioning as an enhanced @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf], the robe can now store up to 10 levels worth of spells at a time and it can store spells of all levels.
  • You can now use your action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles at will. When casting plane shift from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left.

Additionally, gain complete control of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's third and final wing, which includes the ritual room, the annex arcanum, and the spell compendium.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf] at will, requiring no spell components and no concentration. When cast that way, the DC for the spell's Charisma saving throw is 15 or your spell save DC, whichever is higher.
  • While inside the library's ritual room, you can perform a special ritual over the course of 1 hour, at the conclusion of which you speak the full title of a specific book and attempt to magically summon it to you. The nearest copy of that book that isn't held or carried instantly appears in your hands regardless of physical or planar distances. If another creature is holding or carrying the only copy of the book, or if the book is protected against teleportation or planar travel, performing that ritual does not transport the book to you, but instead you learn who the creature possessing the book is and roughly where the book is located at that moment.

Shuffleflush's Cunning Coin.name: Shuffleflush's Cunning Coin
Shuffleflush's Cunning Coin.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], common

Stories have it that the legendary halfling gambler, Shiny Shuffleflush was the first to use magic to get a coin to land on its edge in order to win an impossible bet. Since then, countless such coins have found themselves in the hands of aspiring grifters and master scammers alike.

This coin looks like an ordinary gold piece that feels somewhat lighter than it should. When tossing it, you can use your reaction to mentally command it to land on any side you choose, including landing on its edge.

Rope of the Titan.name: Rope of the Titan
Rope of the Titan.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope glimmers almost imperceptibly and feels smooth to the touch. The rope has been reinforced with durable spellstring and infused with subtle abjuration magic.

The rope has AC 25 and 50 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It can be burst with a DC 30 Strength check.

Humongous Spider Egg (the Arachniarch's.name: Humongous Spider Egg (the Arachniarch's Egg)
Humongous Spider Egg (the Arachniarch's.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], artifact

This horse-sized egg looks like an ancient boulder and is completely impervious to damage. As it gets closer to Spidermas, nothing seems to happen, but if this is indeed the egg of the legendary Arachniarch, it might one day hatch into a tremendously powerful and massive spider! After it hatches, the humongous baby spider likes to gently nudge smaller creatures with its head and pick up and carry random items and even small buildings around, trying to be helpful. It requires sixty-four times as much food and water as a medium-sized creature each day.

With care and nurture, the humongous baby spider grows into the @UUID[Compendium.orelyns-opus-of-outstanding-objects.actors.Actor.4NfHlxN3n1zvkFxj] (CR 21) after four years. The Arachniarch is friendly to you and your companions. Thanks to its massive size, it can carry entire buildings on its back as long as they fit in a 50-foot cube, and it will happily do so for you and your companions. Unless trained to fight, it tries to shield you and your companions from harm during combat, placing its enormous body between you and your enemies to grant you full cover. It typically does not attack unless trained to, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Seal of the Seal.name: Seal of the Seal
Seal of the Seal.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon (requires attunement)

Bestowed to paladins of Nature who undertake quests at sea, a Seal of the Seal gives its wielder an edge against aquatic enemies.

While attuned to the Seal of the Seal, you can choose to float on or sink in water and other liquids at will, regardless of weight.

You can use your action to attach the seal to a piece of armor or clothing by pressing the seal against it. Thereafter, the seal can't be removed unless you detach it as another action, your attunement to the seal ends, or the piece of armor or clothing is destroyed. Not even an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] causes it to fall off.

Navy Seal. While the Seal of the Seal is attached to a piece of armor or clothing you wear, you have a swimming speed equal to double your walking speed and advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to swim. You can also hold your breath for a number of minutes equal to 30 x your Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 minutes).

Seal the Deal. While attuned to the Seal of the Seal, you can communicate with seals, and they are always friendly to you unless you harm them first.

Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (.name: Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (Flurry Maiden)
Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (.description:
Weapon (longbow), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

It was a dark day for the white dragonkind when Yukihana, one of the white dragonfather's favorite daughters, fell in battle during the Civil Dragonwars. Yukihana's fate was torment beyond death, as Odon, the warring god of eternal life, captured her soul and laid claim on her remains, transforming her into a fearsome undead dragon under his dark command.

During the transformation, Yukihana's entire clutch was destroyed except for one last egg out of which hatched Miyuki, Yukihana's youngest daughter. Yukihana's adult offspring were able to recover only a single rib from her remains during her terrifying transformation, and the monster that Yukihana had become has been plaguing the white dragonkind ever since.

A century later, Miyuki, now a young white dragon hiding in mortal form to escape the wrath of the gods, crafted a fearsome bow out of her mother's white rib, vowing to lay her spirit to rest. Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib retains a hint of Yukihana's spirit, guiding whoever wields it to defend dragons against the warring gods. Now, the bow is waiting for a worthy champion to unlock its true potential.

Snowflake. While attuned to this bow, you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic bow.
  • While holding the bow, you can use a bonus action to create 20 dragonfrost arrows. These arrows ignore half cover and resistance to cold damage. After ten minutes, dragonfrost arrows melt into fresh mountain water.

Flurry Maiden (level 11). After you reach level 11, the bow increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
  • The bow deals an extra 1d8 cold damage to any target it hits.
  • You gain resistance to cold damage.
  • When you hit a large or smaller creature with an attack using this bow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to half until the start of your next turn.

White Lady (level 17). After you reach level 17, the bow achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
  • The extra cold damage increases to 2d8.
  • You gain immunity to cold damage.
  • When you hit a huge or smaller creature with an attack using this bow, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (.name: Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (Flurry Maiden)

Greater Sun Whip.name: Greater Sun Whip
Greater Sun Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), legendary (requires attunement)

Created by an eccentric vampire hunter of angelic ancestry to outsmart her elusive prey, this weapon produces a luminous whip made of pure radiance that can strike foes with the power of the blazing sun.

When inactive, this item appears to be a whip handle. While holding it, you can use a bonus action to cause a luminous whip of pure light to spring into existence, or make the whip disappear. Made of pure radiance, the Greater Sun Whip has the light property.

Luminous Lash. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra 2d8 radiant damage.

Radiant Reach. The luminous whip emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. Instead of a whip's regular reach, the Greater Sun Whip allows you to attack any target within the 15-foot-radius sphere of bright light it emits.

Armor of the Defiant Dawn.name: Armor of the Defiant Dawn
Armor of the Defiant Dawn.description:
Armor (medium or heavy, but not hide), very rare (requires attunement)

First worn by an adventurer who dared defy Nelchior, the warring god of night and dark secrets, this armor has been infused with motes of the Eternal Light that allow its wearer to see the unseen and bring light to the darkest of places.

While you wear this armor, you can use an action to cause it to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the armor's bright light. You can use a bonus action to end this effect.

Luminous Retribution. This armor has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. When you are hit with an attack while wearing this armor, you can use your reaction and spend 1 charge to cause the armor to flash with blinding light in a 15-foot radius. Any creature in this light excluding you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d8 radiant damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded by this effect. Undead creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Foundry Note

This item functions as a magical item template. You can create a magic item by dragging one of the effects off this sheet and onto another item.

First open the item, change to the Effects tab, and drag the effect onto your item. This will apply the enchantment, add activities and other effects, and update the item's description and other properties with all the needed information.

If you want to revert the changes to the item, you can then simply remove the enchantment.

Wand of Whooping Explosions.name: Wand of Whooping Explosions
Wand of Whooping Explosions.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by a technognome supervillain in a crisis of megalomania, this volatile wand can turn mundane objects into deadly explosives. Designed to strike from afar and without revealing the supervillain's identity, the Wand of Whooping Explosions can be targeted through scrying sensors or the eyes of faithful minions.

Bombify. This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges and target a Medium or smaller nonmagical object that is not being worn or carried that you can see on the same plane of existence regardless of distance and line of sight.

The targeted object's structure becomes explosively unstable for the next minute. While the object is in this unstable state, it explodes if it takes 1 point of damage. You can also use your bonus action to cause as many affected objects as you wish to explode at once.

Each creature within 5 feet of an object that explodes that way must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one explosion is affected only once.

Thread of the Labyrinth.name: Thread of the Labyrinth
Thread of the Labyrinth.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Woven from persistent illusions and given as a gift of love to a hero of ages past, this ball of magic thread allows you to navigate the mightiest of mazes and find your way when lost.

While no creature is attuned to the thread, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary ball of thread. When a creature attunes to it, the thread's true nature is revealed.

While attuned, the thread is invisible to everyone except the creature attuned to it and creatures with truesight. Only the creature attuned to it and creatures with truesight can interact with it.

Untangled Guidance. When unraveled at a specific point, the Thread of the Labyrinth allows you to retrace your way back to that point without a fault as long as you are on the same plane of existence. While attuned to the thread, you can use a bonus action to magically ravel it back into a ball. The thread can extend for a number of miles equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one) and is impervious to tangling.

Labyrinth Mastery. While attuned to the Thread of the Labyrinth, you have advantage on any ability checks related to navigating the interior of buildings, as well as any magic labyrinth created by maze or similar spells and effects.

Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Sworn.name: Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Sworn)
Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Sworn.description:
Armor (any), evolving artifact (requires attunement by a warlock)

Created by an ancient warlock who ascended to godhood and became the patron of others, this polymorphic armor bestows tremendous power to warlocks who seek mastery of arcane secrets. However, dark sages and mad occultists warn that this otherworldly power comes at a price…

Affirmed. While wearing the armor, you gain the following benefits:

  • The armor grants you a +1 bonus to AC.
  • As an action, you can cause the armor to assume any light, medium, or heavy armor type.
  • You suffer no harm in temperatures as cold as -20 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit while wearing this armor.
  • You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.udsLtG0BugXHR2JQ] at will.

Promised (level 5). After you reach level 5, the armor increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +2.
  • You gain one extra eldritch invocation of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same invocation whenever you attune to this item again. You can only replace this invocation when you gain a warlock level.
  • You can use a bonus action to sense other warlocks of the same otherworldly patron type as you within 1 mile of you for 1 minute. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it at the next dawn.

Sworn (level 11). After you reach level 11, the armor is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +3.
  • You gain a second extra eldritch invocation of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same invocation whenever you attune to this item again. You can only replace this invocation when you gain a warlock level.
  • The armor functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf].

Devoted (level 17). After you reach level 17, the armor achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor becomes equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 3).
  • You gain a second pact boon of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same pact boon whenever you attune to this item again.

Bariq, the Red Spark.name: Bariq, the Red Spark
Bariq, the Red Spark.description:
Weapon (scimitar), artifact (requires attunement)

Forged in the heart of an entropic maelstrom by a deranged aberrant demigod, Bariq took the shape of the weapon its insane creator thought would bring the chaotic storms it so loved in the world of mortals. Now lost in the kaleidoscopic dunes of Prisma Desert, Bariq is all but forgotten, its chaotic magic waiting to be unleashed again.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It deals an extra 3d6 lightning damage to any target it hits, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. The weapon gains an additional +1 to attack and damage rolls if you are outdoors in stormy conditions.

Forged in Chaos. Bariq crackles with red lightning that immediately betrays its profoundly magical nature. It's lightweight yet indestructible by ordinary means.

The Red Spark. While holding Bariq, you can use your action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IyikgTEOTv701jgQ] (spell save DC 20) from it at will. When cast this way, lightning bolt produces red lightning that ignores lightning resistance.

Eye of the Maelstrom. While attuned to this weapon, you are immune to lightning damage. Additionally, whenever a spell or effect that deals lightning damage is created or passes within 30 feet of you, you can bend its path and condense its power so that it passes through your space and you become the single target of this spell or effect within that radius (no action required).

Entropic Link. While holding Bariq, you can use a bonus action to hide it into an extradimensional space, the entropic maelstrom where it draws its powers from. While Bariq is hidden, fractal lightning scars appear all over the hand and arm that held it. You can use another bonus action to retrieve Bariq from the entropic maelstrom.

The Divider (Sharpened).name: The Divider (Sharpened)
The Divider (Sharpened).description:
Weapon (greataxe), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

When the royal geomancers foresaw the downfall of Underking Varadun, the last defiant ruler of the deep dwarves, the Underking challenged the demigod Rolim the Technurge to arm his strongest defenders with weapons so powerful that could fight fate itself. Accepting the challenge, the Technurge opened his timeless vault and bestowed fabled weapons upon the Underking's defenders, and then toiled over his enchanted anvil to create the Divider, a new artifact of mythical power for the Underking's mightiest champion.

Yet it was treachery that brought about the kingdom's downfall as the champion turned the Divider against the Underking and seized the crown, plunging the realm into chaos. The Technurge watched in horror as his creations became instruments of betrayal and even sought to intervene, violating ancient pacts that forbade him from taking sides in wars between mortals. But not even a demigod could alter the kingdom's fate. Disappointed and embittered, the Technurge condemned the new kingdom and broke the ancient pacts, claiming back his dangerous gifts and sealing them into his timeless vault once again.

Tempered. While attuned to this weapon, it has the following properties:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greataxe.
  • The weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage and deals double damage to objects and structures.
  • You can't be disarmed of this weapon unless you are incapacitated.
  • You must eat and drink twice the normal amount each day.

Sharpened (level 11). After you reach level 11, the greataxe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
  • Attacks with The Divider instantly destroy magical barriers, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb].

Staff, very rare (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

The secretive wizard order of the Fateweavers seek to predict, alter, and ultimately control the future. In their bid for magical supremacy, the Fateweavers use divination and powerful rituals of prognostication to find sources of ancient power and uncover hidden truths about the fabric of the cosmos and the warring gods that seek to dominate it.

Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib (.description:
Weapon (longbow), evolving artifact (requires attunement)

It was a dark day for the white dragonkind when Yukihana, one of the white dragonfather's favorite daughters, fell in battle during the Civil Dragonwars. Yukihana's fate was torment beyond death, as Odon, the warring god of eternal life, captured her soul and laid claim on her remains, transforming her into a fearsome undead dragon under his dark command.

During the transformation, Yukihana's entire clutch was destroyed except for one last egg out of which hatched Miyuki, Yukihana's youngest daughter. Yukihana's adult offspring were able to recover only a single rib from her remains during her terrifying transformation, and the monster that Yukihana had become has been plaguing the white dragonkind ever since.

A century later, Miyuki, now a young white dragon hiding in mortal form to escape the wrath of the gods, crafted a fearsome bow out of her mother's white rib, vowing to lay her spirit to rest. Shirabara Daikyu, Yukihana's White Rib retains a hint of Yukihana's spirit, guiding whoever wields it to defend dragons against the warring gods. Now, the bow is waiting for a worthy champion to unlock its true potential.

  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic bow.
  • While holding the bow, you can use a bonus action to create 20 dragonfrost arrows. These arrows ignore half cover and resistance to cold damage. After ten minutes, dragonfrost arrows melt into fresh mountain water.

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.

  • You gain resistance to cold damage.
  • When you hit a large or smaller creature with an attack using this bow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to half until the start of your next turn.

White Lady (level 17). After you reach level 17, the bow achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
  • The extra cold damage increases to 2d8.
  • You gain immunity to cold damage.
  • When you hit a huge or smaller creature with an attack using this bow, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

Noble Taster's Spork.name: Noble Taster's Spork
Noble Taster's Spork.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

Crafted by court wizards to protect nobles from assassination, this magic utensil is an indispensable tool for any self-respecting food taster, as well as for adventurers who dare sample unusual and exotic delicacies.

This spork has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2skfDtglk1mGrb3l] spell from it. The spork regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

You have advantage on all saving throws related to foodborne poisons and diseases from any food you eat using this spork. Additionally, you have resistance to poison damage from eating poisoned food with this spork.

Royal Flying Throne.name: Royal Flying Throne
Royal Flying Throne.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary

Ancient sun elf nobles used these disks to fly up to the fabled floating palaces that defied gravity at the height of the elven kingdom of Per-Menoth. Today, the secrets of crafting Flying Disks are closely guarded by a few half-elven descendants of Per-Menoth, as well as the secretive wizard order of Fateweavers.

You can speak the disk's command word as an action to make the disk hover and fly. It moves according to your spoken directions, provided that you are within 30 feet of it.

This variant of the Flying Disk is a 10-feet-radius disk with a luxurious ceremonial chair in the middle. It can carry up to 5000 pounds and has a flying speed of 30 feet. The throne flies at half speed if it carries more than its normal capacity.

Disk Transformation. As bonus action, you can order your Royal Flying Throne to arcanomechanically transform and fold into a coin-sized token. In this form, the throne cannot fly. You can use another bonus action to unfold the Royal Flying Throne again.

The Royal Flying Throne has 5 charges. A creature sitting on the throne can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.L4J89JXqbKs6puEV] spell from it. When cast that way, teleport transports the throne and up to eight willing creatures of the caster's choice that are on the disk. The throne regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn.

Rope of the Trickster.name: Rope of the Trickster
Rope of the Trickster.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels slightly greasy to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle conjuration magic.

Any creature that knows the rope's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to instantly untie any knot on its length or make any section of it slippery smooth. Creatures have disadvantage on any ability checks and saving throws related to climbing or holding on to the rope while it's slippery.

Rope of Vanishing.name: Rope of Vanishing
Rope of Vanishing.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope looks completely mundane and unremarkable. The rope has been infused with subtle illusion magic.

Any creature that knows the rope's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to turn it invisible. The rope remains invisible until it is cut, or until a creature that knows its nature touches it and uses another bonus action to make it visible again.

Staff of Elemental Mastery.name: Staff of Elemental Mastery
Staff of Elemental Mastery.description:
Staff, shattered artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

When all pieces have been recovered, the Staff of Elemental Mastery is made whole again.

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +3 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

While attuned to the staff, you have resistance to cold, fire, and lightning damage; as well as to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Additionally, you can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not incapacitated and you can breathe air and water, you can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, attuning to the staff increases its range by 60 feet. Moreover, you can speak, read, and write all Primordial dialects.

  • Fire Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5SuJewoa1CRWaj1F] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J3uILDYS7MiOfmTJ] (7 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FjYE214HTERCRZNm] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7u2obDvuvtZBkTfq] (2 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X3DrXgxjwI2dvkD6] (4 charges).
  • Water Spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RpKjTlYASrfqUPVA] (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7fFHlBk3UNX8gPKL] (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZPd73HtKF3At11jh] (8 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fzZnVKLmBMo2f5up] (6 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.YBda6nLKjxdT1LbS] (3 charges).

Elemental Cantrip Mastery. While holding the staff, you can cast the following cantrips at will. If you already know any of the following cantrips, the staff allows you to cast them using your bonus action: bonfire, earth mold, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.EOmsUcFQJTfG2oio], flame control, frostnip, minor gust, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.eCPQuQkIabFKTl9u], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ctW81uiX56xZR2c5], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XvbiNhNqXXIFisIy], or water shape.

  • You gain immunity to the damage types associated with the chosen element of your transformation: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for earth; cold damage for water; fire damage for fire; and lightning damage for air.
  • When you use the staff to cast one of the spells associated with the chosen element of your transformation, that spell does not consume any charges.
  • You can use your reaction to automatically cancel or redirect a spell cast or a magical effect created within 120 feet of you that deals damage associated with the chosen element of your transformation, unless the spell or effect had been created by a deity or originated from another artifact. If the spell or effect has one or more targets, you can choose different targets for that spell or effect.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you end it early (no action required), until you use this feature again to transform into an avatar of another element, or until you cast a spell that deals any other type of damage except the damage types associated with the chosen element of your transformation.

Glowing Skycrystal Shard.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by ancient mages, this crystal shard holds a mote of the unending magic of creation.

As an action, you can focus your mind onto the Skycrystal Shard and create the effect of one spell that has a casting time of 1 action. The maximum level of the spell you can create depends on the shard's rarity as shown in the table below.
