Fabulous Wig.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

Created by a legendary drag queen who mastered the art of transformation, this magic wig helps bards to be more fabulous and rogues to be sneakier.

You can use your action to wear the wig, which magically adjusts to fit perfectly onto your head. Thereafter, the wig can't be removed unless you detach it as an action or you die. Not even an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] causes it to fall off.

Feeling the Fantasy. While wearing this wig, you can use a bonus action to cause it to take on any hairstyle you wish. The wig physically changes its color, length, and texture to match the new hair style. You can also use this property to instantly clean or soil the wig.

Wig Reveal. You can wear a number of Fabulous Wigs at once equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one).

Realness. While worn, the Fabulous Wig is indistinguishable from real hair. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell can reveal the wig's true nature while worn. The wig envelops whoever wears it in a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8].

Hair Pull Immunity. While wearing this wig, you are immune to any damage related to hair pulling.

Serpentis the Snakeblade.name: Serpentis the Snakeblade
Serpentis the Snakeblade.description:
Weapon (longsword), artifact (requires attunement by an elf or half-elf)

Serpentis was once Ismatun, a young moonblade in service of the noble elves of the wandering pyramid of Shekrish. However, when the serpentaurs of Shekrish betrayed their elven masters, they claimed Ismatun as one of the spoils of their treachery. Seeking to subvert the blade's will, serpentaur priests infused Ismatun with ophidian magic, warping its form in an attempt to wield its mythical power. This torturous process lasted for decades, and while the serpentaurs never managed to subdue and control the blade's personality, the mighty sword transformed, becoming the Snakeblade, Serpentis.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the finesse property and deals an extra 2d8 slashing damage and an extra 2d6 poison damage to any targets it hits.

Serpentis makes you immune to poison and the poisoned condition, and grants you blindsight out to 60 feet. It has the following additional properties:

Whip Sword. As a bonus action, you can cause Serpentis to transform, extending its segments to become a whip sword and gain the reach property. You can use another bonus action to retract the segments again.

While Serpentis is extended, you can use the Attack action to make a special restraining attack on a large or smaller creature. If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. You make an attack roll contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) check or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If you win the contest, the attack deals no damage and you submit the target to the restrained condition as Serpentis wraps around it.

While the sword holds a target restrained, you can only use it to attack that target and you do so with advantage due to the restrained condition.

A restrained creature can use its action to escape. To do so, it must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check contested by an attack roll with Serpentis. You make this special roll when a target attempts to escape (no action required).

Ophidian Master. While attuned to Serpentis, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X8w9EzYLGc4vQ1H2], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu], and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hDOENzjuj5WpLq7B] at will, targeting only snakes.

Serpentine Fear. As an action, you can instill fear into any snake or serpentaur of your choice within 60 feet. These targets must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

Sentience. Serpentis is a sentient lawful neutral weapon with an Intelligence of 12, a Wisdom of 10, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing, darkvision, and blindsight out to a range of 120 feet. It can communicate with its wielder telepathically. The weapon knows Elvish, Celestial, and Draconic, as well as any languages its wielder knows. It hisses when it senses enemies, and its segments rattle threateningly when used in combat.

Personality. After decades of torture in the hands of treacherous serpentaur priests, Serpentis harbors a seething hatred for anyone who would betray and seek to harm the elven race. It regards all serpentaurs, even those who never betrayed the sun elves, with extreme prejudice.

Serpentis will not serve anyone it considers an enemy of elvenkind. If the blade believes you acted against the common interest of elvenkind, it ends your attunement to it immediately and if you are in physical contact with the blade when that happens, you must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you take 20d6 poison damage and become poisoned for 1d4 days. When poisoned that way, you are incapacitated. On a successful save, you take half as much damage and aren't poisoned by this effect.

The blade secretly harbors a deep desire to come into contact with pure moonblades and be accepted for what it has become. If Serpentis believes its wielder can physically move it within 5 feet of a pure moonblade, it will try to persuade its wielder to facilitate a meeting. As long as it remains within 5 feet of a moonblade that accepts it, Serpentis can communicate telepathically with it.

Library of the Blue Candles (Empowered).name: Library of the Blue Candles (Empowered)
Library of the Blue Candles (Empowered).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement)

The Library of the Blue Candles is a legendary repository of arcane knowledge hidden between dimensions, accessible through a scholar's robe. Underking Galdruman, Sage-King of the deep dwarves, was said to have the most extensive collection of rare tomes in his personal library, the secret Library of the Blue Candles.

In the aftermath of a violent uprising, the Sage-King fled into exile and those who usurped his power sought to discover the location of the library to no avail. Underking Galdruman had taken his library with him, and the secret of its location was lost with his death.

Using powerful magic, the Sage-King had hidden his library in a pocket dimension that one could access through a well-crafted, robust, but seemingly unassuming scholar's robe. Now, whoever dons the robe once more can attempt to master that dimension and claim the knowledge contained within.

Dormant, First Wing. While wearing this robe in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 11 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4dSvfvTy2ZIJ3K4k], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3].
  • You can focus on the robe's magic for 1 minute to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles. When casting @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left. You can use this property without consequences a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus until the next dawn. Each time you use this property after you have used it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus before the next dawn, you and any other target of the plane shift spell gain 1d4 levels of exhaustion.

Additionally, attuning to the robe makes you the planar ruler of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's first wing, which includes the teleportation circle, the index, the secret lounge, and the central repository of knowledge.
  • You control planar travel to the library. You can designate which creatures can enter the library through planar travel and only creatures using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] or divine intervention can enter the library against your will. Portals created by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XbwGq5kDJNvAxNXV] spell can only open in the library if you allow them to.
  • While inside the library, you can use an action to summon any book that you know is in the library to your hands.
  • You may study a skill or a tool in the library as part of a long rest. Doing so gives you a +10 on a single ability check within the next day that is related to that skill or tool.

Empowered, Second Wing (Level 11). After you reach level 11, the robe increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against illusion spells.
  • The robe functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf].
  • You can use an action to cast one of the following additional spells from the robe at will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.gopnZvS0c2jD5FP8] (self only).
  • When you are hit by an attack or subjected to an effect that would damage you, you can use your reaction to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] targeting only yourself. When casting plane shift that way, you are transported to the Library of the Blue Candles and avoid all damage from the triggering attack or effect. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Additionally, your command over the Library of the Blue Candles grows, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's second wing, which includes the main library hall, the forbidden history section, the hidden office, the living quarters, the kitchen, and the mess hall.
  • You gain the power to influence the flow of time inside the library. You and any creatures you designate can gain the benefits of a short or a long rest by spending only half the time required while resting inside the library. Additionally, you can double or halve the duration of any spells cast within the library.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg] as part of a long rest, requiring no material components.

Supreme, Third Wing (Level 17). After you reach level 17, the robe achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You are immune to @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB] and any magical effects that reduce Intelligence.
  • Functioning as an enhanced @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf], the robe can now store up to 10 levels worth of spells at a time and it can store spells of all levels.
  • You can now use your action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] to or from the Library of the Blue Candles at will. When casting plane shift from the library that way, you can only target the plane you reached the library from, and you arrive at the exact spot from where you had left.

Additionally, gain complete control of the Library of the Blue Candles, which grants you the following additional benefits related to the library:

  • You gain access to the library's third and final wing, which includes the ritual room, the annex arcanum, and the spell compendium.
  • While inside the library, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf] at will, requiring no spell components and no concentration. When cast that way, the DC for the spell's Charisma saving throw is 15 or your spell save DC, whichever is higher.
  • While inside the library's ritual room, you can perform a special ritual over the course of 1 hour, at the conclusion of which you speak the full title of a specific book and attempt to magically summon it to you. The nearest copy of that book that isn't held or carried instantly appears in your hands regardless of physical or planar distances. If another creature is holding or carrying the only copy of the book, or if the book is protected against teleportation or planar travel, performing that ritual does not transport the book to you, but instead you learn who the creature possessing the book is and roughly where the book is located at that moment.

Heavy Spider Egg.name: Heavy Spider Egg
Heavy Spider Egg.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare

This gnome-sized egg is heavier than it looks. As it gets closer to Spidermas, you can hear a steady hum coming out of it. After it hatches, the heavy baby spider likes to weave webs in dark corners. It requires four times as much food and water as a medium-sized creature each day.

With care and nurture, the heavy baby spider grows into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.v99wOosUJjUgcUNF] (CR 1) after 180 days. This giant spider is friendly to you and your companions. It likes to hang out on its webs and gaze at people coming and going, and it loves to watch over you and your companions while you sleep. Unless trained to fight, it prefers to climb out of reach and use its Web ranged weapon attack to restrain enemies during combat, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Resplendent Skycrystal Shard.name: Resplendent Skycrystal Shard
Resplendent Skycrystal Shard.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Crafted by ancient mages, this crystal shard holds a mote of the unending magic of creation.

As an action, you can focus your mind onto the Skycrystal Shard and create the effect of one spell that has a casting time of 1 action. The maximum level of the spell you can create depends on the shard's rarity as shown in the table below. The spell can be from any class's spell list, and you don't need to meet the requirements in that spell, including costly components; the spell simply takes effect as part of this action, using your spell save DC, spellcasting ability modifier, and spell attack bonus.

Once the Skycrystal Shard is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

TypeRarityMaximum Spell Level
Glimmering Skycrystal ShardUncommon1
Glowing Skycrystal ShardRare3
Shining Skycrystal ShardVery Rare5
Resplendent Skycrystal ShardLegendary7

Dress of Outrageous Opulence.name: Dress of Outrageous Opulence
Dress of Outrageous Opulence.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare (requires attunement)

Sewn from the finest materials and imbued with powerful enchantments for a haughty princess who absolutely wanted to impress, this dress has since found its way in the possession of various extravagant heroes across the centuries who don't shy away from high fashion.

Made to Last. This dress never gets dirty and magically mends itself to counteract daily wear and tear.

Light as a Feather. The Dress of Outrageous Opulence is light as a feather and magically airy. When you fall while wearing this dress, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to make it billow dramatically.

Alluring Attractiveness. Your Charisma score is 21 while you wear this dress. If your Charisma is already 21 or higher, the dress increases your Charisma score by 1 instead, up to a maximum of 30.

Chimes of the Peaceful Path.name: Chimes of the Peaceful Path
Chimes of the Peaceful Path.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon (requires attunement)

Created as a gift to a young pacifist cleric, these chimes are infused with a desire for peace and the redemption of struggling souls.

While attuned to these chimes, you can jangle them to create a light chiming noise that can be heard only by creatures of an alignment of your choice up to 300 feet away. The chiming noise penetrates magic barriers and grants those who hear it advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to find you.

The chimes have 3 charges. You can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3MYDjS6k9IYL0aTj] (DC 10) with a radius of 30 feet centered on yourself. The chimes regain all charges daily at dawn.

When casting calm emotions using a spell slot while attuned to these chimes, you can expend 1 charge to add a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for that singular casting of calm emotions.

Net of the Trickster.name: Net of the Trickster
Net of the Trickster.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels slightly greasy to the touch. The rope has been infused with subtle conjuration magic and woven into a net.

Any creature that knows the net's nature can touch it and use a bonus action to instantly untie any knot on its length or make any section of it slippery smooth. Creatures have disadvantage on any ability checks and saving throws related to climbing or holding on to the net while it's slippery.

Masterful Makeup Kit.name: Masterful Makeup Kit
Masterful Makeup Kit.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare

Created by a legendary drag queen who mastered the art of transformation, this magic makeup kit allows anyone to put on any type of makeup and face painting imaginable, create tattoos, change their skin color, and live the fantasy.

The kit comes with a magically-refillable array of cosmetics and dyes, facial props including noses and horns, and a fierce makeup removal towel.

Makeup Mastery. You can spend 10 minutes to put on makeup that visually alters your facial features, and the color and texture of your skin. Your face can appear as the face of a member of any other race with which you share the same basic arrangement of eyes, ears, nose, and mouth. Your skin can appear as the skin of a member of any other race, unless that race has fur, scales, or feathers. Otherwise, the extent of this transformation is up to you and may also include conventional makeup and tattoos. This transformation can only be applied to one creature at a time.

Demakeup Resistance. Once applied, makeup from a Masterful Makeup Kit can only be removed with this or another Masterful Makeup Kit, the application of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.MAwoj2suj6cvb9Ti] or Oil of Etherealness, or with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell. Makeup from a Masterful Makeup Kit can also be removed if you die.

Using a Masterful Makeup Kit, you can spend 1 minute to remove any makeup from a face, or 10 minutes to remove any makeup from a body. Universal Solvent, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.Xbq8CyXSRV358SfP], and the wish spell remove any makeup from a Masterful Makeup Kit immediately.

Realness. Unless you purposefully wear it so its nature is obvious, makeup from the Masterful Makeup Kit is indistinguishable from real skin. Only a wish spell can reveal your true features and skin color as long as you wear the makeup. The makeup envelops whoever wears it in a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8].

Stylish Sunblock. While wearing makeup from the Masterful Makeup Kit, you are immune to sunburn.

Venthir's Smart Wizard Hat.name: Venthir's Smart Wizard Hat
Venthir's Smart Wizard Hat.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon (requires attunement)

Originally a gift to a beloved teacher of the arcane, this semi-sentient and undeniably stylish wizard hat has been imbued with elegant divination magic.

While attuned to this hat, you can use an action to mentally ask the hat a yes-no question about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 10 minutes. The gamemaster chooses from the following possible predictions:

  • Affirmative. The hat answers "yes" to your question.
  • Negative. The hat answers "no" to your question.
  • Non-committal. The hat refuses to answer, or its answer is uncertain.

Instead of a direct "yes" or "no", the hat may choose to give its answer with varying degrees of confidence. For example, instead of "yes" it may reply "most likely" if it's somewhat uncertain, or "yes definitely" if it's confident about its prediction.

The hat's divination magic does not consider any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of spells or the loss or gain of a companion.

If you ask the hat four or more times before completing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each question after the third that you get a non-committal answer. The gamemaster makes this roll in secret.

Soul Diamond.name: Soul Diamond
Soul Diamond.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary

Ages past, a dark cult of deranged priests created these diamonds to capture the souls of fallen heroes and villains alike in a mad attempt to control the course of history.

A creature whose soul is trapped in a Soul Diamond can be resurrected only by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell, unless the creature attempting the resurrection is holding the diamond.

While holding the Soul Diamond, you can use your reaction to trap the soul of a creature you can see that dies within 60 feet of you. The soul remains trapped until the creature is resurrected or until you use an action to release it while holding the Soul Diamond. The Soul Diamond can hold only one soul at a time.

When you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zMEo5DKK8uxsuWnq], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LmRHHMtplpxr9fX6], or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qLeEXZDbW5y4bmLY] on a creature whose soul is trapped in the Soul Diamond, you may use the diamond as the material component for the spell. When cast this way, any of the aforementioned spells forcefully resurrects the creature even if it is not willing and empties the Soul Diamond without consuming it in the process.

As long as a soul is trapped in the Soul Diamond, it can telepathically communicate with any creature touching it.

If you die while the Soul Diamond is on your person, your soul becomes trapped in the Soul Diamond, unless it already holds a soul.

Trap Soul.name: Trap Soul
Trap Soul.condition: when a creature within 60 feet dies

Asterite Ring.name: Asterite Ring
Asterite Ring.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Crafted from asterite, a rare and innately magical meteoric metal, this ring has been further imbued with enduring magic.

While wearing this ring, you can use a bonus action and roll 1d6 + 1. You gain a temporary spell slot of that level. This temporary spell slot lasts until it is used, until you finish a long rest, or until the next dawn. The ring can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Fire Fragment.name: Fire Fragment
Fire Fragment.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

While attuned to this fragment, you have resistance to fire damage, and darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, attuning to the fragment increases its range by 60 feet. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Ignan, and you can cast the flame control cantrip at will.

Awakened Fire Fragment. Attuning to the Fire Fragment while also attuned to the Shattered Staff awakens the fragment and it magically merges with the staff, becoming one item that takes up a single attunement slot. After the Fire Fragment has been awakened, the following spells are added to the staff's spell list: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5SuJewoa1CRWaj1F] (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0] (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FjYE214HTERCRZNm] (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7u2obDvuvtZBkTfq] (2 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X3DrXgxjwI2dvkD6] (4 charges).

Rod of Patience.name: Rod of Patience
Rod of Patience.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], artifact (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Forged by the legendary deep dwarf demigod Rolim the Technurge, this indestructible rod empowers its wielder to master the forces that underlie the casting of spells and the creation of magic items.

While you hold this rod, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against you.

Mind Quickening. The Rod of Patience has 7 charges. When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action while holding this rod, you can expend 1 charge and change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting. The rod regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn.

Technurge's Patience. While attuned to this rod, you can harness Rolim's magic to speed up or optimize the creation of magic items. When crafting a magic item, you can choose to use double the materials normally required to magically speed up the process, reducing the crafting time by half. Alternatively, you can choose to use only half the materials normally required and rely on Rolim's magic to complete the process, which doubles the crafting time.

Random Properties. The Rod of Patience has the following randomly determined properties:

  • 2 minor beneficial properties
  • 1 minor detrimental property
  • 1 major detrimental property

Staff of the Spellmaster (Spellmaster Su.name: Staff of the Spellmaster (Spellmaster Supreme)
Staff of the Spellmaster (Spellmaster Su.description:
Staff, evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

Myth has it that an ancient arcanist once unlocked the secrets of every spell known to mortalkind and became known as the Spellmaster. Believing they had reached the apex of their power, the Spellmaster sought to channel all their arcane knowledge into an unbreakable staff and use it as a conduit to achieve immortality through a ritual of their own devise.

The ritual was successful, but along with all knowledge, the Spellmaster unintentionally channeled their own essence, soul, and magic into the staff, becoming one with it and leaving their mortal body behind.

Transformed into an ageless, unbreakable staff, the Spellmaster looked within for meaning and purpose, eventually falling into a deep, trance-like sleep that lasted for ages. Now, the ancient arcanist slumbers within the staff, waiting for a mage capable enough to rouse them from their sleep and awaken their true power.

Slumbering Sage. While attuned to this staff, you gain the following benefits:

  • While holding the staff, you can cast any spell you know or have prepared that's half your level (rounded down) without expending a spell slot. Once you cast a spell that way, you can't do so again until the next dawn.
  • When an enemy successfully casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] on you, only half of the spells active on you end automatically (minimum of one), and any ability checks to end spell effects on you against your will are made with disadvantage.

Awakened Arcanist (level 5). After you reach level 5, the staff increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
  • You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain concentration on spells.
  • The staff gains 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (3 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (3 charges). The staff regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Master Mage (level 11). After you reach level 11, the staff is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells increases to +2.
  • You gain a second reaction that you can only use to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy].
  • The staff's charges increase to 20 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (4th-level version, 4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (4th-level version, 4 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby] (6 charges).

Spellmaster Supreme (level 17). After you reach level 17, the staff achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells increases to +3.
  • The staff's charges increase to 50 and the following spells are added to the spells you can cast from it: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] (8 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] (5th-level version, 5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] (5th-level version, 5 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby] (7th-level version, 7 charges).
  • When casting a spell that requires concentration, you may use as many charges from the staff as that spell's level to make the staff maintain concentration on the spell for you so you can maintain concentration on another spell. The staff can only maintain concentration on one spell at a time and its concentration can be broken only if you drop the staff or if you die.

Sentience. The Staff of the Spellmaster is a sentient lawful neutral staff with an Intelligence of 30, a Wisdom of 13, and a Charisma of 8. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. It can communicate with its wielder telepathically. The staff knows Celestial, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, and Primordial, as well as any languages its wielder knows.

Personality. Having once been one of the strongest mortal mages alive, the Staff of the Spellmaster believes it's no mere item but a mentor who guides other mages to greatness. It will often comment on various spells and magical effects, expecting its words to be treated with respect.

Belt of Gnomekind.name: Belt of Gnomekind
Belt of Gnomekind.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

The legendary technognome demigod of innovation and discovery Sporkus the Inventor tinkered and improved upon the formula for crafting belts of dwarvenkind to create this new and improved belt.

While wearing this belt you gain the following benefits:

  • Your Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with gnomes.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of waking up feeling curious and inventive.

If you aren't a gnome, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
  • You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
  • You can speak, read, and write Gnomish.

Aethis' Belt of Wands.name: Aethis' Belt of Wands
Aethis' Belt of Wands.description:
Wondrous Item, rare (requires attunement)

Created by a methodical mage, this practical belt allows avid wand collectors to make the most out of their prized wands and keep them close at hand.

The belt can hold up to 10 wands designed for Small and Medium-sized creatures. The wands are held securely by the belt and cannot be removed against your will unless you're incapacitated.

Stick Them Up! While attuned to the belt, you can use a bonus action to instantly summon a wand from the belt in any of your hands, stow any wands you might be holding back into the belt, or swap any wands you might be holding with any other wands from the belt.

Concealed Carry. While attuned to the belt, you can use an action to cause the belt and any wands in it to become invisible until you use another action to make it visible again, until you remove the belt, or until you die. The wands become visible when taken out of the belt.

Harmonious Handling. Any wands held by the belt regain 1 additional expended charge whenever they regain charges. Additionally, attuning to any wand held by the belt takes only 1 minute.

Sheath of the War Mage. The belt is equipped with a special sheath designed to hold a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.OPbdSlrhkUDNpgcS]{Wand of the War Mage}. You can attune to the belt and the Wand of the War Mage held in that sheath using a single attunement slot for both items. While attuned to both items that way, you gain the wand's bonus to spell attack rolls even when not holding it, as long as it remains in the sheath.

Strongbow Harp.name: Strongbow Harp
Strongbow Harp.description:
Weapon (heavy crossbow), very rare (requires attunement)

Crafted by an adventurous halfling bard after a failed assassination attempt against him, this magic harp is also a fully functional heavy crossbow.

The Strongbow Harp can be used as a musical instrument and as a heavy crossbow. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with Strongbow Harp.

Tipsy Bolt. The Strongbow Harp has 3 charges. While holding the harp, you can use a bonus action and expend one of its charges to cause translucent, almost invisible poison that smells faintly of alcohol to coat a crossbow bolt loaded into it. If you are playing the harp, this bonus action does not interrupt your performance. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this crossbow bolt hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned that way, the creature is drunk and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. The Strongbow Harp regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

Flying Disk.name: Flying Disk
Flying Disk.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

Ancient sun elf nobles used these disks to fly up to the fabled floating palaces that defied gravity at the height of the elven kingdom of Per-Menoth. Today, the secrets of crafting Flying Disks are closely guarded by a few half-elven descendants of Per-Menoth, as well as the secretive wizard order of Fateweavers.

You can speak the disk's command word as an action to make the disk hover and fly. It moves according to your spoken directions, provided that you are within 30 feet of it.

Five sizes of Flying Disk exist. The gamemaster chooses the size of a given disk or determines it randomly.

@Embed[Compendium.orelyns-opus-of-outstanding-objects.tables.RollTable.GqmLc9jj4IBWykEc caption=false rollable]

A disk can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but it flies at half speed if it carries more than its normal capacity.

Disk Transformation. As bonus action, you can order your Flying Disk to arcanomechanically transform and fold into a coin-sized token. In this form, the disk cannot fly. You can use another bonus action to unfold the Flying Disk again.

Handygnome's Precision Gloves.name: Handygnome's Precision Gloves
Handygnome's Precision Gloves.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Created by gnome artificers who value efficiency, these sturdy gloves have been imbued with potent and practical transmutation magic that helps tinkerers fix things under pressure, but also allows locksmiths and shady characters pick locks more efficiently.

While wearing these gloves, you gain a +5 bonus to any ability checks related to repairing objects and constructs, disarming traps, and picking locks.

Remote Rapid Repairs. While wearing these gloves, you can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL] cantrip from them. When cast that way, mending has a range of 30 feet.

Royal Taster's Spork.name: Royal Taster's Spork
Royal Taster's Spork.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

Crafted by court wizards to protect kings from assassination, this magic utensil is an indispensable tool for any self-respecting food taster, fit to taste the food of kings and queens, as well as for adventurers who dare sample unusual and exotic delicacies.

While holding the Royal Taster's Spork, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2skfDtglk1mGrb3l] spell at will, and you are immune to disease, poison, and the poisoned condition.

Veil of Illusory Armor.name: Veil of Illusory Armor
Veil of Illusory Armor.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

This sheer and almost lightless veil has been imbued with strong illusion magic by crafty caravan halflings.

While wearing this veil, you can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv] spell from it at will. The spell ends if the veil is removed.

Illusory Armor. If you are wearing no armor and use the Veil of Illusory Armor to appear as if you are wearing nonmagical armor, the veil's magic subtly alters your appearance so that you are harder to hit by those affected by its illusion.

Any creature who targets you with an attack while you wear the illusory armor must first make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC (or 8 + your proficiency bonus if you are not a spellcaster). On a failed save, the creature treats you as if you wore the armor projected by the illusion and you have the effective AC of the particular armor you are projecting for that creature.

The creature makes the saving throw with disadvantage if you project the illusion of light armor and with advantage if you project the illusion of heavy armor. Enemies can repeat the saving throw each time they attack you.

To discern that you are not really wearing armor, a creature can also use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC (or 8 + your proficiency bonus if you are not a spellcaster).

A creature that discerns the illusory armor for what it is sees it as a vague image superimposed on you and becomes immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

Skycrystal Shard.name: Skycrystal Shard
Skycrystal Shard.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rarity varies (requires attunement)

Crafted by ancient mages, this crystal shard holds a mote of the unending magic of creation.

As an action, you can focus your mind onto the Skycrystal Shard and create the effect of one spell that has a casting time of 1 action. The maximum level of the spell you can create depends on the shard's rarity as shown in the table below. The spell can be from any class's spell list, and you don't need to meet the requirements in that spell, including costly components; the spell simply takes effect as part of this action, using your spell save DC, spellcasting ability modifier, and spell attack bonus.

Once the Skycrystal Shard is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Medusa's Head.name: Medusa's Head
Medusa's Head.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Myth has it that an ancient hero once beheaded the first medusa and used her petrified head to turn a terrible sea monster into stone. Ages passed, but the head still retains some of the medusa's dark magic, allowing whoever wields it to turn onlookers to stone.

Petrifying Gaze. While holding Medusa's Head, you can use your action to force a creature within 30 feet that can see you to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk] spell or other magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at you in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Promi.name: Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Promised)
Armor of the Otherworldly Invoker (Promi.description:
Armor (any), evolving artifact (requires attunement by a warlock)

Created by an ancient warlock who ascended to godhood and became the patron of others, this polymorphic armor bestows tremendous power to warlocks who seek mastery of arcane secrets. However, dark sages and mad occultists warn that this otherworldly power comes at a price…

Affirmed. While wearing the armor, you gain the following benefits:

  • The armor grants you a +1 bonus to AC.
  • As an action, you can cause the armor to assume any light, medium, or heavy armor type.
  • You suffer no harm in temperatures as cold as -20 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit while wearing this armor.
  • You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.udsLtG0BugXHR2JQ] at will.

Promised (level 5). After you reach level 5, the armor increases in power, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +2.
  • You gain one extra eldritch invocation of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same invocation whenever you attune to this item again. You can only replace this invocation when you gain a warlock level.
  • You can use a bonus action to sense other warlocks of the same otherworldly patron type as you within 1 mile of you for 1 minute. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it at the next dawn.

Sworn (level 11). After you reach level 11, the armor is further empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor increases to +3.
  • You gain a second extra eldritch invocation of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same invocation whenever you attune to this item again. You can only replace this invocation when you gain a warlock level.
  • The armor functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf].

Devoted (level 17). After you reach level 17, the armor achieves its full potential, gaining the following additional properties:

  • The AC bonus of the armor becomes equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 3).
  • You gain a second pact boon of your choice. Once chosen, you gain the same pact boon whenever you attune to this item again.

Poison of Oblivion.name: Poison of Oblivion
Poison of Oblivion.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

Harvested from elusive giant spiders that dwell in enchanted caves, this poison has the power to send even the mightiest foes into a deep, dreamless sleep.

A vial of Poison of Oblivion holds a single dose. As an action, you can coat one slashing or piercing weapon, one piece of ammunition, or a trap that deals slashing or piercing damage with this poison. Once applied, the poison retains its potency for one year or until a creature takes slashing or piercing damage from the item that was coated with it.

A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon, a piece of ammunition, or a trap coated with Poison of Oblivion must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 4d6 hours. While poisoned this way, the creature is unconscious and immune to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kSPRpeIx3w3nihrF] spell and can only wake up if it takes 10 damage or more on a single round.

Vanarion the Harp.name: Vanarion the Harp
Vanarion the Harp.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], artifact (requires attunement by a non-evil bard)

This exquisitely crafted harp houses the soul of legendary dark elf bard Vanarion who sought to spread love and beauty to the Overworld. Persecuted by evil forces, Vanarion had to channel his essence into his unbreakable harp to avoid certain death.

A creature that attempts to play Vanarion without his consent must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or take 3d8 psychic damage.

Magic Repertoire. You can use an action to play Vanarion and cast one of the spells from Vanarion's Spell List below. Once Vanarion has been used to cast a spell, he can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

Vanarion maintains concentration on any spells cast from his spell list that require concentration so that you don't have to.

Vanarion's Spell List. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uUWb1wZgtMou0TVP] (5th level), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.nqBDWkVOfcGZt4YU], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yfbK8gZqESlaoY5t], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TfRzwEgBHHkCc6Ql], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xmDBqZhRVrtLP8h2], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.HQfd7jJyULIoGxrZ].

Sentience. Vanarion is a sentient chaotic good harp with an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 8, and a Charisma of 20. He has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. He can communicate telepathically with any creature he can see within 60 feet of him. His telepathic messages ring melodic and pleasant. Vanarion knows Common, Draconic, Dwarvish, and Elvish.

Personality. Vanarion honestly believes he was the most talented bard that has ever existed. In his new life as an unbreakable harp, he seeks to aid and guide bards who would fight to make the world a better place.

Iridescent Spider Egg.name: Iridescent Spider Egg
Iridescent Spider Egg.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

This barrel-sized egg is almost weightless and glows faintly when touched. As it gets closer to Spidermas, you can hear otherworldly plinks and plonks coming out of it. After it hatches, the iridescent baby spider likes to relax in the mist between dimensions, also known as the ethereal plane, and shift back to reality whenever it feels lonely or gets hungry. It requires four times as much food and water as a medium-sized creature each day.

With care and nurture, the iridescent baby spider grows into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.llSG0Hi4eGlRlQ4o] (CR 3) after a year. This phase spider is friendly to you and your companions. It will keep an eye out for enemies trying to sneak up on you and your companions through the ethereal plane. Unless trained to fight, it prefers to hide in the ethereal plane during combat, but it will defend itself from hostile creatures.

Bell Tower of the Peaceful Path.name: Bell Tower of the Peaceful Path
Bell Tower of the Peaceful Path.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

A legendary variant of the Chimes of the Peaceful Path.

While attuned to the bell tower, you can jangle them to create a light chiming noise that can be heard only by creatures of an alignment of your choice up to 10 miles away. The chiming noise penetrates magic barriers and grants those who hear it advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to find you.

The bell tower has 3 charges. You can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3MYDjS6k9IYL0aTj] (DC 20) with a radius of 1 mile centered on the bell. The bell tower regains all charges daily at dawn.

When casting calm emotions using a spell slot while attuned to the bell tower, you can expend 1 charge to add a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for that singular casting of calm emotions.

[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon (requires attunement)

Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Empowered).name: Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Empowered)
Freewalker's Shadowgarb (Empowered).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], evolving artifact (requires attunement by a sorcerer)

Crafted by a sorcerer of supreme prowess, this morphing outfit appears to be made of a multicolored shimmering silk and can take the form of any outfit the wearer desires. Its true power has since lain dormant, waiting for someone worthy to release its potential.

Dormant. While wearing the outfit in its dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

  • You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv] at will.
  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

Empowered (level 11). After you reach level 11, the artifact becomes empowered, gaining the following additional properties:

  • You have a swimming, climbing, and flying speed equal to your walking speed while wearing this outfit.
  • This outfit gains a number of charges equal to your Charisma modifier. You can spend 5 feet of movement and one charge to automatically escape restraints, or end an effect that reduces your speed or causes you to be grappled, paralyzed, restrained, or stunned. You can escape multiple restraints and end multiple effects, expending 5 feet of movement and one charge of this feature per effect. You regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

Supreme (level 17). After you reach level 17, the outfit evolves into its supreme state, gaining the following additional properties:

  • Your Charisma score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You can ignore the verbal and somatic components of spells you cast.
  • When you use the Subtle Spell Metamagic feature, you can also ignore any material component that has no gold cost.
  • You can use your action to gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN] spell. This effect can be active for up to an hour, all at once or in shorter intervals of a minimum of 1 minute for the duration. This time limit resets daily at dawn.

Eyes of Rolim.name: Eyes of Rolim
Eyes of Rolim.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], legendary (requires attunement)

Built by the deep dwarf demigod Rolim the Technurge, these arcane-infused spectacles allow sages to skim through entire libraries, solve magic mysteries, and discern the true nature of illusions and shapeshifting creatures.

While wearing the Eyes of Rolim, you have truesight out to 10 feet.

Arcana Mastery. While wearing the Eyes of Rolim, you have advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when examining magic items, creations wrought by magic, spell effects, magic abilities, and supernatural phenomena. Additionally, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH] at will.

Rolim's Sagacity. While wearing the Eyes of Rolim, you can read all writing that you see through the eyes' lens. Additionally, you can read at triple your normal speed and have advantage on Constitution checks and saving throws related to mental fatigue from prolonged cognitive activity.

Void Blade.name: Void Blade
Void Blade.description:
Weapon (Longsword), Rare (requires attunement)

This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure darkness to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the Void Blade.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals necrotic damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a humanoid with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 necrotic damage.

Net of the Titan.name: Net of the Titan
Net of the Titan.description:
Weapon (net), uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope glimmers almost imperceptibly and feels smooth to the touch. The rope has been reinforced with durable spellstring and infused with subtle abjuration magic and woven into a net.

The net has AC 25 and 50 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It can be burst with a DC 30 Strength check.

Potion of Bottled Language (Exotic).name: Potion of Bottled Language (Exotic)
Potion of Bottled Language (Exotic).description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare

Prized by merchants and diplomats alike, these potions have been infused with the concentrated essence of a language. Different potions for different languages exist, and potions infused with exotic or dead languages are often more expensive than potions of more common languages.

When you drink this potion, you can magically speak, read, and write the language whose essence the potion includes for 1 hour.

This potion's color may vary depending on language and dialect, but all variants have tiny translucent letters floating in them. Shaking the bottle momentarily combines the letters into random words of the language it includes.

If you drink one potion of the same bottled language every day for 30 days, you permanently learn to read and write that language.

Linguistic Intoxication. If you drink a Potion of Bottled Language while still under the effects of another Potion of Bottled Language you must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or become linguistically intoxicated for 1 hour. While linguistically intoxicated, you feel light-headed and your speech is slurred; and you can only speak, read, and write only the languages of the potions that currently affect you.

Belt of Halflingkind.name: Belt of Halflingkind
Belt of Halflingkind.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], rare (requires attunement)

Created by a determined halfling wizard after she encountered belts that correspond to other races and found them lacking, this belt allows everyone to experience life from the perspective of a halfling.

While wearing this belt you gain the following benefits:

  • Your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with halflings.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of waking up feeling optimistic and happy-go-lucky about your day.

If you aren't a halfling, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
  • You can speak, read, and write Halfling.

Rope of Sickness.name: Rope of Sickness
Rope of Sickness.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], uncommon

This 50-foot length of rope feels uncomfortably moist and has a musty smell. The rope has been infused with subtle necromancy magic.

Any creature restrained by this rope is also subjected to the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, a creature can't regain hit points.

Bag of Prodigious Props.name: Bag of Prodigious Props
Bag of Prodigious Props.description:
[[lookup @item.type.label]], very rare

Created by a legendary drag queen bard, this outrageously diverse and exotic collection has virtually every prop you will ever need to radically transform your appearance.

You can use your action to reach into the bag and pull out any prop you are looking for that can alter your appearance, including claws, ears, fangs, feathers, fins, fur, horns, hooves, scales, tails, tentacles, wings, and other distinguishing characteristics at the gamemaster's discretion.

You can spend 1 minute to apply a prop directly on your body. Thereafter, the prop can't be removed unless you detach it as an action or you die. Not even an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] causes it to fall off.

Prolific Props. You can wear a number of prodigious props at once equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one).

Realness. Unless you purposefully wear it so its nature is obvious, a prop from the Bag of Prodigious Props looks perfectly real but does not grant you additional abilities. You can't use prop wings to fly, for example. The props also can't make you appear as a creature of a different size than you, and you cannot use them to increase the number of functional arms, legs, or heads you have.

Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell can reveal the true nature of the prop while worn. The prop envelops whoever wears it in a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8].
